Title: Junior Analyst per il Governo del Credito
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Junior Analyst per il Governo del Credito – Performance Management Bonis a Milano.

Sei appassionato/a di data analytics, sviluppo modelli AI, e desideri intraprendere la tua carriera nel settore bancario e finanziario? Questa potrebbe essere l'opportunità giusta per te!




Principali responsabilità:

Analisi quantitative: gestione avanzata dei database, sviluppo e monitoraggio di modelli evoluti di early warning, analisi econometrico-statistiche e backtesting.
Misurazione delle Performance e Reporting: elaborazione flussi periodici di dati, monitoraggio dell'attività di prevenzione default, controllo dei processi di classificazione, assegnazione degli obiettivi gestionali e analisi degli scostamenti da KPI, reporting direzionali.
Interazione con le strutture aziendali: collaborazione continua con le diverse funzioni aziendali per garantire l’efficacia dei controlli e l’aggiornamento dei sistemi.




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente stimolante e in continua evoluzione, dove mettere in pratica le tue competenze analitiche e sviluppare nuove conoscenze e collaborazione con esperti nel settore del Risk Management e opportunità di crescita professionale.

Requisiti

Laurea Magistrale in Applied Data Science for Banking and Finance, Scienze Finanziarie, Bancarie, Statistiche, Economia (con specializzazione in Financial Economics, Data Science o Business Analytics) o simili, Ingegneria; Scienze Statistiche;
Neolaureato con forte background accademico e tesi di laurea con analisi empirica o esperienza di 1-2 anni in ambito Risk Management e Controllo Rischi di Credito.
Ottima conoscenza di Microsoft Office e strumenti di analisi statistica (Python, SAS, R).
Fluente in inglese, sia scritto che parlato.
Buone capacità relazionali, predisposizione al lavoro in team e forte orientamento ai risultati.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Credit Collection (f/m/x)
HTML:
Position Overview

Deutsche Bank offre servizi e prodotti di banca commerciale, banca d'investimento, transaction banking, asset e wealth management ad aziende, governi ed enti pubblici, investitori istituzionali, piccole e medie imprese, famiglie e privati. Deutsche Bank è la banca leader in Germania, con un forte posizionamento in Europa e una presenza significativa nelle Americhe e nell'area Asia Pacifico.

L’Italia rappresenta il suo primo mercato europeo, dopo la Germania, e l’Istituto è tra i più importanti gruppi internazionali presenti nel Paese.

La Risorsa verrà inserita all’interno del Team Collection di Milano. Obiettivo del team è quello di gestire le attività di recupero crediti riferite al portafoglio retail di DB SpA.

La Risorsa, ricoprendo il ruolo di Data Analyst, verrà inserita all’interno del Team Collection di Milano. Obiettivo del team è quello di gestire le attività di recupero crediti riferite al portafoglio retail di Deutsche Bank S.p.A.

La sede di lavoro potrà essere Milano, oppure Padova.

Le responsabilità assegnate sono:

  • Creare nuovo reporting e manutenere l’attuale dashboard di monitoraggio del portafoglio apportandone costante miglioramenti;
  • Analizzare l’andamento dei principali KPI oltre ad approfondire e comprendere gli eventuali motivi di scostamento;
  • Monitorare il cost/income ratio dei diversi canali di recupero;
  • Verificare il rispetto delle assunzioni utilizzate in fase di forecasting;
  • Condurre analisi ad hoc per indirizzare le decisioni di gestione ed ottimizzazione del portafoglio;
  • Partecipare a progetti inerenti l’ambito di competenza dell’Unità Organizzativa tra cui UTP ed NPE;
  • Supportare l’esecuzione di attività di controllo sulla conformità dei processi;
  • Realizzare presentazioni per il Management;
  • Relazionarsi con gli altri team dell’Unità Organizzativa oltre agli stakeholders locali e globali.



    • Le competenze richieste sono:

    • Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica o Ingegneria;
    • Pregressa esperienza di almeno 3 anni in ruoli analoghi, preferibilmente in organizzazione strutturate in ambito finanziario;
    • Avanzato utilizzo di SAS/SQL anche applicato alla creazione di modelli;
    • Avanzato utilizzo del Pacchetto Office;
    • Ottimo inglese
    • Passione per l’analisi e la gestione dei dati;
    • Spiccato orientamento al risultato e al problem solving;
    • Autonomia nell’organizzazione del lavoro;
    • Pensiero analitico e capacità di sintesi;
    • Buone doti relazionali e negoziali


    Well-being & Benefits

    Ci impegniamo a fornire un ambiente di lavoro che metta al centro lo sviluppo delle persone, rispettando la loro unicità e i loro bisogni.

    Sosteniamo i nostri dipendenti a prendersi cura del proprio benessere mentale e fisico invitandoli a riflettere sui temi della mental health, pianificando webinar, incontri dedicati e offrendo loro una Personal Support Line. Garantiamo un posto di lavoro smart e innovativo oltre ad un programma di assistenza sanitaria, welfare e convenzioni aziendali a supporto di percorsi di prevenzione e cura della propria salute fisica.

    Crediamo fortemente nell’inclusione per ampliare nuove prospettive e rafforzare la fiducia in sé stessi migliorando il benessere collettivo. A supporto del work-life balance mettiamo a disposizione permessi retribuiti di congedo parentale e altri strumenti per favorire il Family Caring.

    Forniamo soluzioni per sostenere la sicurezza finanziaria, tra cui il Fondo Pensione Integrativo, la Polizza Long Term Care e condizioni agevolate per i nostri prodotti finanziari.

    We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

    Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

    We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Title: Consumer Knowledge & Data Analyst Internship
Description:
FULL-TIME | 6-MONTHS | FROM MARCH




We are looking for an engaged and passionate Consumer Knowledge & Data Analyst Intern to join our Digital Engagement & Loyalty team at the Global Headquarters in Milan, Italy.




MAIN ACTIVITIES:




Support the extraction and analysis of customer data lists collected across different touchpoints
Analyze cross-channel client behaviors to drive valuable insights across the organization
Run analysis on the current customer base to forecast growth and identify strategic insights for future initiatives
Effectively present reports and insights to different departments.




REQUIREMENTS:




Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master’s in Economics, Statistics or Engineering Master degree or similar
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, including excellent knowledge in Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of programming languages: SQL and Python
Preferred experience with Google Cloud Platform
Enthusiastic, willing to learn and self-organized
Strong analytical skills, with an eye for details
Fluent in English.




YOUR FUTURE EXPERIENCE WITH US:




An extraordinary internship path: different activities, events and experiences design to help you develop yourself and become part of our community;
Our Career Start Program: to expand your knowledge by taking exclusive courses and by guided by your team;
Monthly reimbursement & ticket lunch / free access to the canteen for lunch.




“Moncler Group is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of Ethnic origin, Skin color, Religion, Civil status, Age, Nationality, Ancestry, any form of disability or neurodivergence, medical condition, Gender, Gender Identity or Expression, Sexual Orientation. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.”

Title: Data Analyst - Credito | Settore energetico
Description:
Descrizione azienda

Il nostro cliente è uno dei principali operatori del mercato libero dell'energia elettrica e del gas naturale, con circa 800.000 clienti su tutto il territorio nazionale. Dispongono, con controllo diretto e indiretto, di impianti di generazione elettrica per circa 4.800 MW di potenza installata e siamo uno dei maggiori operatori italiani nella commercializzazione di elettricità e gas naturale. La strategia si fonda su un modello flessibile di produzione e gestione dell’energia, per accelerare la transizione energetica del nostro Paese. Ogni giorno si impegna per portare ai clienti energia sostenibile e servizi, resi semplici, personali e condivisibili tramite tecnologie digitali. Per i loro clienti rendono disponibili elettricità, gas, fibra ultra veloce, soluzioni fotovoltaiche e servizi per l’efficienza energetica.

Anno di nascita: 1999

Dipendenti totali: 646

L'azienda pone forte attenzione al cliente e il focus client oriented passa prima da una visione people oriented: lavorare in questa realtà significa non solo crescita professionale, ma anche poter lavorare in un ambiente dove la scala valoriale è alta in termini di contenuti e avvalorata dalla struttura.

Posizione

Nel tuo nuovo ruolo, entrerai a far parte della Direzione ICT C Customer Service nell’Area “Customer Value, Analytics and Platform”.

Su cosa lavorerai Ti occuperai delle principali attività di reporting e analisi relative all’area Credito.

Nello specifico: Supporto analitico nella gestione dei processi relativi al rischio credito, alla morosità e al recupero dei crediti. Definizione, implementazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio dei KPI e della reportistica operativa e direzionale per l’area Credito; Gestione, in autonomia e con il supporto di fornitori esterni, delle attività inerenti le consegne normative e indagini dell’Autorità di settore relativamente ai dati di fatturato, credito e incasso; Analisi della customer base e generazione insights al fine di orientare le decisioni dell’area per minimizzare il tasso di unpaid. Presentazione dei dati periodici in occasione dei meeting operativi e direzionali; Gestione autonoma del deploy delle soluzioni applicative Qlik-sense

Requisiti

Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di QlikSense
Conoscenza dei concetti e delle tecniche di Data warehousing (Back-End) e di Business Intelligence (Front-End)
Buona conoscenza lingua inglese
Ottime capacità di analisi e attitudine al problem solving;
Ottima capacità di lavorare per obiettivi e in team, anche interfacciandosi con interlocutori sia interni che esterni

Altre informazioni

Sede di Lavoro: Milano

Smart working: 2gg a settimana post onboarding (3 mesi)

Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst
HTML:
Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Entra nella practice Customer Transformation di PwC e diventa:

Customer Data Scientist

Your Perspectives

Ti unirai al gruppo di Customer Transformation di PwC su sfidanti progetti di Customer Advance Analytics e Data Science in ambito Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Energy&Utilities e Telco&Media, per supportare le organizzazioni nel valorizzare il patrimonio informativo sui propri Clienti e Consumatori finali, utilizzando i dati a disposizione per sviluppare soluzioni innovative basate su Machine Learning.

Grazie all’accesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.

Sarai Coinvolto Con Crescenti Responsabilità Nelle Seguenti Attività

  • Disegno, sviluppo, test e misurazione delle performance di modelli di Machine Learning e di modelli statistici in ambito Marketing: segmentazioni, Customer scoring, modelli di classificazione, modelli predittivi, modelli di propensione/raccomandazione;
  • Analisi dati avanzate sul comportamento dei Clienti sia su canale fisico che digitale attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati, al fine di derivare insight di business;
  • Sviluppo di analisi quantitative e modelli di Machine Learning a supporto di progettualità di data-driven Strategy & Decision Making;
  • Attività di targeting evoluto e valutazione quantitativo-statistica delle campagne di Marketing;
  • Raccolta dei requisiti progettuali a diretto contatto con il cliente per il disegno e l’elaborazione di soluzioni data-driven;

Your unique strengths

  • Stai concludendo o hai concluso il percorso di studi o possiedi una laurea magistrale preferibilmente ad indirizzo scientifico (es. Data Science, Informatica, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica);
  • Hai un’ottima conoscenza di almeno uno tra i linguaggi Python ed R;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza dei database relazionali e del linguaggio SQL;
  • Hai forti competenze analitiche e ti interessa usare i dati per trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a problemi complessi;
  • Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente;
  • Ti interessa lavorare in team e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo;
  • Sei flessibile e hai forte motivazione ad intraprendere una carriera professionale in consulenza;

Saranno considerate un plus, le conoscenze, anche a livello base di:

  • Framework Spark e piattaforme Cloud come Amazon Web Services, Azure e Google Cloud Platform;
  • Artificial Intelligence in ambito Speech Analytics, Natural Language Processing o Computer Vision;

Title: STAGE - DATA ANALYST
Description:
Responsabilità principali:


Elaborazione e analisi dei dati provenienti dal sistema gestionale aziendale (Cegid).
Realizzazione di report e dashboard per il monitoraggio delle performance.
Analisi dati: Sell-in e sell-out, Incassi, KPI aziendali, Venduto per categoria e prodotto.
Analisi delle giacenze di magazzino e dei negozi per ottimizzare la distribuzione della merce.
Pianificazione e gestione delle triangolazioni merceologiche.
Assegnazione della merce ordinata



Requisiti richiesti:


Titolo di studio: Diploma o laurea in ambito economico, statistico, logistico o simile ( Supply Chain Management, Data Analytics, Economia).
Competenze tecniche:
conoscenza di Excel (pivot, formule avanzate).
conoscenza di base di strumenti per l'analisi dei dati e per la business intelligence
Soft skills:
Problem solving e capacità di lavorare per obiettivi.
Eccellenti doti di comunicazione e capacità di lavorare in team.
Spirito proattivo e intraprendente.
Lingua: Conoscenza base dell’inglese (utile per l’analisi di report).


Cosa offriamo:


Stage iniziale con possibilità di inserimento stabile e crescita professionale
Retribuzione stage: €800 netti/mese + buoni pasto.
Formazione on-the-job e affiancamento diretto al Supply Chain Manager.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choreograph is the global data and technology business unit in GroupM. It unifies the data, analytics, technology consulting, and technology expertise across the GroupM network in a dedicated unit that enhances data and analytics services and deploy best-in-class media planning, activation, and measurement tool and methodologies.

We are looking for a Data Ananlyst to join our Measurement team, composed by 22 Consultants. The team is young, talented, and dynamic.

The candidate will work closely with both internal WPP/GroupM Agencies and external clients on business with the aim to provide strategic and tactical insight in order to optimize marketing investments and maximize ROI.

Responsibilities


Measure and analyze impact of marketing activities on client business goals
Analyze different type of metrics like business data, macro-economic dynamics, web analytics, media and marketing investments, promotion, call center data and other relevant factors
Develop Marketing Mix Models, Regression Based Attribution Models, Multi-touch Attribution and other analytical solutions to provide data driven recommendation supporting media investment allocation and planning
Evaluate different Marketing and Media Scenarios, forecasting business results and supporting marketing strategy
Manage the relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to lead the whole analysis process, from data collection up to final presentation and discussion with the client
Design and develop performance reports, defining the Key metrics & actionable insight


About You


A curious and data-oriented mindset, with economic-mathematic-statistic background
Strong analytical skills set and problem solving
Excellent communication and presentation skills, combined with the ability to collaborate across teams
Strong interest for the interpretation of business data
Excel and PowerPoint proficient
Knowledge of the English language
Have a strong orientation toward team working, collaboration and support of colleagues, while always maintaining a positive approach
3+ years of working experience


The knowledge of the following will be considered as a plus:


Previous experience with Marketing Mix Modeling/Econometric Modeling
BI tools like PowerBI, Data Studio, Tableau, QlikView
Python/R/Sql/Google Cloud Platform/Scripting Skills
Previous experience in a Consulting/Analytic Roles


LOCATION

WPP Campus in Milan (plus the option for hybrid working).

We are proud to have a team made up of individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that this diversity is a strength. This position is also open to individuals belonging to Categorie Protette under Law 68/99.

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come Data Analyst all’interno del team Data Driven Insights. La struttura ha lo scopo di svolgere le analisi dati a supporto delle attività e delle iniziative del Marketing, delle Strutture di vendita, del Customer Service, supportando nell’identificazione delle strategie di business ottimali delle Società della Business Unit Mercato. 

Per quale Società

L’attività della Business Unit Mercato è finalizzata alla vendita al dettaglio di energia elettrica e di gas naturale ai clienti del mercato libero e alla commercializzazione ai clienti serviti in regime di tutela. Inoltre, si occupa di fornire servizi di efficienza energetica e di mobilità elettrica.

Ti occuperai di


Analisi strategiche a supporto delle decisioni del business, in particolare legate ai fenomeni contingenti di mercato. Aggiornamento periodico delle analisi, continuo adeguamento alle richieste dei clienti interni, proposizione di nuovi approfondimenti. Predisposizione delle viste e delle rappresentazioni per i SAL periodici
Sviluppo di nuovi report o viste sulla base dei requisiti espressi dai clienti interni, seguendo l’intero processo: dalla parte di analisi dei dati e degli aspetti tecnici alla presentazione dei risultati
Manutenzione evolutiva ed automazione di analisi/report esistenti
Sviluppo di codice per l’elaborazione automatica di dati estratti dalla Data Platform a supporto delle attività di marketing e vendita della società della BU Mercato e la presentazione dei risultati (analisi statistiche, test di ipotesi, studi di correlazione di variabili, valutazione degli intervalli di confidenza associati alle statistiche prodotte, calcolo di indicatori, variabili derivate e KPI di business, …)


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Data Science, Matematica, Ingegneria
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni nella analisi e gestione dei dati, preferibilmente in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Esperienza consolidata del linguaggio SQL
Esperienza pratica di linguaggio R
Padronanza di tecniche di data visualisation
Ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto Office
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza di Power BI, esperienza pratica nell’uso di BigQuery su Google Cloud Platform ed esperienza pratica di linguaggio Python
Completano il profilo: attitudine al problem solving, proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla condivisione delle informazioni e ottime doti comunicative e relazionali


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversità, l’equità e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilità di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull’etica e sulle pari opportunità garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversità.

La selezione è rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Scopri di più sul Gruppo a2a

Opportunità di lavoro   https://t.ly/CiTRn

Le nostre persone   https://t.ly/djoa3

Formazione   https://t.ly/Nr5Fr

Ascolta “Accanto”, il Podcast che racconta cosa significa oggi lavorare in A2A  https://t.ly/pRaU4

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio

Consigli per l’iter di selezione   https://t.ly/N6pil

Processo di selezione   https://t.ly/iGij7

  • Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
  • Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull’etica e sulle pari opportunità garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversità.

La selezione è rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Scopri di più sul Gruppo a2a

Opportunità di lavoro   https://t.ly/CiTRn

Le nostre persone   https://t.ly/djoa3

Formazione   https://t.ly/Nr5Fr

Ascolta “Accanto”, il Podcast che racconta cosa significa oggi lavorare in A2A  https://t.ly/pRaU4

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio

Consigli per l’iter di selezione   https://t.ly/N6pil

Processo di selezione   https://t.ly/iGij7

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
HTML:
A proposito di fifty-five: 

fifty-five è una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta più di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,  supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realtà omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Contesto: 

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.

Mansioni: 

In qualità di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.

Il vostro ruolo sarà di: 

  • Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualità e affidabilità; 
  • Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media; 
  • Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente; 
  • Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore;
  • Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics); 
  • Sviluppare nuove opportunità di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto; 
  • Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda; 
  • Partecipare alla concezione e al posizionamento dell'offerta tecnologica di fifty-five.


Profilo ricercato: 

Laureato/a in discipline STEM o economia , con 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti di Tracking / Misurazione / Web Analytics.

Competenze: 

  • Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT;
  • Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di web analytics  (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, AT Internet...); Tag Management System (GTM, Launch, Tealium, Commanders Act, ...)
  • Conoscenze di JavaScript (comprensione e sviluppo di logiche semplici) e Web in generale; 
  • Forte spirito analitico; 
  • Eccellente comunicazione orale e scritta; 
  • Grande passione per le tecnologie e il settore di internet; 
  • Competenze in ambiente mobile sono un plus; 
  • Conoscenze del funzionamento dei CMP sono un plus; 
  • Buona capacità di proporre soluzioni perfettamente in linea con le esigenze; 
  • Buon livello sia di italiano che di inglese.

I vantaggi di lavorare in fifty-five: 

  • Politica di smart working;
  • Particolare attenzione all'equilibrio vita privata / vita professionale nel rispetto del diritto alla disconnessione; 
  • Un ambiente multiculturale con collaboratori di oltre 20 nazionalità diverse; 
  • Valori interni incentrati sull'eccellenza, la benevolenza e la condivisione;
  • Formazione continua (e riconosciuta) sull'ecosistema, le tecnologie digitali e sulle soft skills (es: public speaking, gestione del team ecc.);
  • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti interni come Data Hive (un progetto "tech for good" promosso dai dipendenti di fifty-five, il cui scopo è mettere le loro conoscenze e competenze a disposizione di organizzazioni benefiche), DEI@55 (un gruppo di lavoro sui temi della diversità e dell'inclusione all'interno di fifty-five e della tecnologia più in generale), Sustainability@55 (un team che aiuta a implementare pratiche sostenibili internamente e presso i nostri clienti).

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversità e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parità di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, età, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. Incontra il team di fifty-five!

Localizzazione: Corso Giacomo Matteotti 1, CAP 20121 Milano

Tipo di contratto: Contratto di lavoro a tempo pieno e indeterminato

Salario: in base all'esperienza

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Pardgroup S.p.A, società leader operante nei settori del Marketing Operativo sulla GDO/GDS, dei Servizi Retail e delle vendite, in ottica di potenziamento del proprio organico, ricerca una figura di Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire in organico.


La risorsa, inserita all’interno della divisione Business Intelligence, dovrà svolgere le seguenti attività:

  • Analisi dati provenienti dal field e dal cliente;
  • Aggregazione dati, individuando le metodologie di analisi più idonee;
  • Progettazione Dashboard in Tableau e costruzione di Dataset;
  • Interpretazione del dato e analisi critica dello stesso;
  • Predisposizione di presentazioni relative alle analisi eseguite.


Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede i seguenti requisiti:

  • Precedente esperienza almeno di 1/2 anni in ruolo analogo;
  • Laurea ad indirizzo tecnico/scientifico;
  • Eccellente conoscenza di Excel;.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Buona conoscenza di almeno un tool di ETL (in particolar modo Prep);
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e di problem solving


Nice to have: conoscenza di Tableau e del linguaggio SQL


Completano il profilo attitudine nella gestione del cliente e spiccate capacità relazionali e comunicative.


"Pardgroup Spa informa che la ricerca è rivolta ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). Ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento 679/2016 (GDPR) i dati sensibili e particolari comunicati dal candidato tramite l'invio del CV sono raccolti e trattati secondo quanto indicato nella normativa privacy accessibile al seguente link (https://www.pardgroup.com/privacy-policy) e per quanto occorrer possa, con l'invio dello stesso CV, il candidato ne autorizza il trattamento"

Title: IT Data Analyst
Description:
Azienda italiana leader per la raccorderia, operante a Nord di Milano, ricerca un:




IT Data Analyst




Il candidato dovrà essere il punto di riferimento interno per i software utilizzati all’interno dell’organizzazione e l’interfaccia con i fornitori software esterni, monitorando l’analisi dei processi aziendali (mappatura processi e criticità, design processi, individuazione dei dati rilevanti da monitorare) e fornendo spunti per il miglioramento degli stessi.




Avrà altresì ruolo di Data Analyst.

Il Data Analyst, esperto nell’analisi, interpretazione e gestione di grandi volumi di dati, avrà l’obiettivo di estrarre, elaborare, gestire e rappresentare informazioni utili per supportare decisioni strategiche aziendali. Attraverso l’uso di strumenti avanzati, linguaggi di programmazione e metodologie statistiche, il Data Analyst dovrà trasformare dati grezzi in insight significativi, favorendo l’efficienza e la crescita delle varie linee di business.




Principali Responsabilità




Interlocutore interno per le problematiche gestionali applicative che insorgono dai dipartimenti.
Interlocutore con i vari fornitori software e con i PM di progetto.
Sviluppo e gestione di report, dashboard e KPI per il monitoraggio delle performance aziendali.
Collaborazione con diversi dipartimenti per definire metriche di successo e requisiti di analisi.
Implementazione e documentazione di processi per l’automazione e il miglioramento dell’analisi dei dati.
Monitoraggio e aggiornamento continuo delle tecnologie e metodologie di analisi.




In dettaglio dovrà occuparsi di:




Gestire le problematiche interne aziendali relativamente all’utilizzo dei software interni da parte dei diversi dipartimenti aziendali (Sap Business One, Qlik Sense e software di produzione).
Monitorare e gestire la risoluzione delle problematiche da parte dei fornitori esterni.
Partecipare all’analisi delle nuove esigenze di processo e gestionali, partecipare alla definizione del capitolato di progetto e seguire i diversi step di realizzazione da parte dei fornitori esterni con particolare attenzione al testing e alla messa in produzione del progetto stesso.
Costruire dashboard interattive con strumenti di BI (Power BI, Qlik Sense) per rendere accessibili le informazioni ai team aziendali.
Fornire aggiornamenti e insight sintetici agli stakeholder attraverso report grafici e presentazioni personalizzate.
Sviluppare soluzioni per automatizzare processi di reporting e analisi ricorrenti.
Monitorare continuamente i sistemi di raccolta e gestione dati, identificando aree di miglioramento.
Integrare nuove tecnologie e strumenti analitici per aumentare l’efficienza e la precisione delle analisi.
Creare e aggiornare documentazione relativa ai processi aziendali e di analisi e gestione dati.




Competenze chiave:




Conoscenza dei processi aziendali di una azienda di produzione e commercializzazione di prodotti.
Analisi dei dati: raccolta, elaborazione e analisi di dati strutturati e non strutturati. Capacità di identificare trend, modelli e anomalie nei dati.
Strumenti di visualizzazione: esperienza nell’utilizzo di tool come Power BI, o Qlik per creare dashboard interattive e report visivi.
Pensiero critico e problem-solving: capacità di porre domande giuste, definire problemi e proporre soluzioni.




Requisiti:




Titolo di studio: laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale, Informatica, Economia, Matematica o discipline affini.
Esperienza: esperienza nella gestione di gestionali aziendali e software di analisi dei dati. Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza di Sap Business One e Qlik Sense.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Soft Skills:




Attitudine al lavoro in team.
Capacità di gestire progetti multipli rispettando le scadenze.
Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli.
Proattività nell’anticipare le necessità di analisi dei dati.

  • Integrare nuove tecnologie e strumenti analitici per aumentare l’efficienza e la precisione delle analisi.
  • Creare e aggiornare documentazione relativa ai processi aziendali e di analisi e gestione dati.

  • Conoscenza dei processi aziendali di una azienda di produzione e commercializzazione di prodotti.
  • Analisi dei dati: raccolta, elaborazione e analisi di dati strutturati e non strutturati. Capacità di identificare trend, modelli e anomalie nei dati.
  • Strumenti di visualizzazione: esperienza nell’utilizzo di tool come Power BI, o Qlik per creare dashboard interattive e report visivi.
  • Pensiero critico e problem-solving: capacità di porre domande giuste, definire problemi e proporre soluzioni.


Requisiti:


  • Titolo di studio: laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale, Informatica, Economia, Matematica o discipline affini.
  • Esperienza: esperienza nella gestione di gestionali aziendali e software di analisi dei dati. Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza di Sap Business One e Qlik Sense.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Soft Skills:


  • Attitudine al lavoro in team.
  • Capacità di gestire progetti multipli rispettando le scadenze.
  • Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli.
  • Proattività nell’anticipare le necessità di analisi dei dati.

Title: Senior Specialist - Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Data Platform & Analytics







Working in the Data Platform & Analytics team at Sky Italia means finding solutions to address challenges, providing a first-class data platform, and identifying and building advanced use cases that extract value from data to generate actionable insights in compliance with all standards.




Role Purpose




With the aim to maximize the value of data, support the business, and foster the development and growth of the Big Data platform, the candidate will join the Machine Learning Development team to manage end-to-end analysis activities, driving the data analytics transformation and evolution toward data-driven approaches.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with different business units to define use cases, ensuring win-win solutions to be developed or enhanced.
Analyze use cases from both functional and technical perspectives, working closely with Data Architects and Data Engineers to define solutions.
Support Project and Delivery Managers during the feasibility analysis phase of initiatives.
Adopt technical standards aligned with software development strategies and process automation.
Propose ideas and evaluate technological or process opportunities to innovate existing solutions.
Maximize the value of Sky’s data assets by leveraging heterogeneous datasets, raw data, and complex models through descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics techniques.




Additional Activities:

Conduct requirement analysis and effectively communicate results.
Communicate project goals and plans clearly to cross-functional teams.
Participate in meetings with business stakeholders and development teams, adhering to technical standards in line with corporate guidelines.
Assess the adoption of Big Data architectures versus Data Warehousing solutions (on-cloud or on-premise).
Perform impact analysis for the company’s core projects.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Experience in data analysis across relational and non-relational databases.
Strong knowledge of data architecture and SQL/NoSQL, including querying, modeling, and data structures.
Expertise in Python/R or other programming languages for advanced analytics and machine learning usecases.
Proficiency in data reporting and analysis tools (e.g., Tableau).
Proven experience in developing/managing reports and dashboards and presenting data effectively, clearly, and comprehensibly.
Preferred knowledge of data modeling and data enrichment techniques.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in English.

Title: Industry Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA)

Schedule

Full-time

Salary (Pay Basis)

1,286.09

Grade

INTERN

For more than 75 years, NATO’s mission has been to preserve peace and security in the Alliancefor nearly one billion citizens. The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) is NATO’s technology and cyber hub. We are a team of 3000 civilian and military staff, working together to connect all corners of NATO and maintain its Edge from 30 locations across the Alliance.

We are a key partner in NATO's Digital Transformation, working hand in hand with industry to provide technical solutions and expertise, facilitating political consultations and decision-making, and enabling multi-domain operations.

Our experts provide secure static and deployable communications infrastructure, satellite communications and information technology services, connected the Alliance’s forces, and strengthening NATO’s defence and deterrence posture. Fulfilling NCIA’s missions is possible because of our greatest force, our people. In order to reinforce NATO’s edge, we aim to hire, train and retain the very best staff.

Our staff members represent both the diversity and unity of our Alliance. When you join NCIA, you will be part of an organization where you can contribute authentically to the mission and purpose of NATO and help us ensure seamless connectivity among Allied partner nations.

About The Program

The NCIA internship is a 6-month program based at one of our key hubs in The Netherlands, Belgium or Portugal. Our internship opportunities start from either 1 March or 1 September with the start date being dependent on the timeline to secure the required security clearance to work within the NATO community. During an internship, you will join and support a diverse international team and simultaneously learn from our experts via on-the-job training, working independently on purposeful projects or initiatives during your tenure.

About The Internship

Internship duration: 6 months

Location: Brussels, Belgium

The Office of the Chief of Acquisition (COA) provides the full range of acquisition expertise and activities that support the planning, implementation and maintenance of the required capability in support to the Agency’s strategic goals and missions. These functions include Contracting and Acquisition Lifecycle, which includes Integrated Product Support and Cost Estimating and Analysis. COA controls all NCI Agency procurement activities to ensure effective risk management and protects the legal and financial liabilities of the Agency by implementing the best practices to all acquisition activities, including Lifecycle Acquisition.

This internship position is with Industry Relations Team (IRT), under Acquisition Office.IRT is responsible for advising the Chief of Acquisition and the NCIA General Manager on all Industry Relations matters to include strengthening existing relationships with the private sector and not-for-profit organizations as well as building new ones, in direct support of the Agency’s Strategic Plan.

Internship Duties


Support the implementation of the Industry Strategic Engagement Plan (ISEP) through various tasks, primarily focusing on research, analysis and stakeholder engagement
Collect and analyse data from diverse sources (e.g., industry databases, surveys, open-source platforms) to support planning and reporting activities. Develop actionable, data-driven recommendations.
Present complex information in visually appealing formats tailored to different audiences and stakeholders.
Collaborate with internal cross-agency teams and external industry representatives to ensure alignment and effective communication.
Prepare reports, background documents, correspondence, and meeting minutes. Manage follow-ups on pending tasks to ensure timely execution.
Assist in planning and implementing industry engagement activities or visits in alignment with the ISEP.


About You

The valuable knowledge and experience that you bring to this role is:

Business Situation Analysis

Investigates straightforward business situations to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.Contributes to the recommendation of improvements.Follows agreed standards and techniques to investigate, analyse and document business situations.Engages with stakeholders under direction.

Knowledge Management

Maintains a knowledge management database.Leverages knowledge of a specialism to capture and classify content, taking expert advice when required.

Research

Within given research goals, assists in selection and review of credible and reliable resources.Searches for relevant material using specialised websites and sources, reads relevant articles to update knowledge of the relevant field.Reports on work carried out and may contribute sections of publication-quality material.Curates, under guidance, a personal collection of relevant material.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible to apply for our internship program, you will need to meet the following criteria:


You are a national of a NATO member country
You are currently studying towards a university-level degree or have recently graduated in the past 12 months
A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable. Most of the work of the NCI Agency is conducted in the English language.


We also request that you please attach the following documents to your application form:


Copy of the university degree you have completed and/or
Proof of ongoing studies with the dates clearly mentioned if you are still studying


Application Process

The application process for an internship at NCIA is:

Ø Apply via the NCIA Careers site by 23:59 CET 16 th March 2025

Ø If selected to progress to the first stage evaluation this will consist of a logic, numeracy and behavioral gamification exercises in addition to on-demand video questions aligned to the requirements of the internship

Ø Virtual interviews will take place in the month of April

Ø Tentative offer to be presented to successful candidates in early May

Compensation

Belgium

You will be compensated at a fixed taxable rate of 1,286.09 EUR per month, based on 38 hours of work per week and for reasonable travel expenses to start on day 1 and to return to your home location once the internship is complete.

Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.To learn more about NCIA and our work, please visit our website .

NCIA prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCIA career site.

  • Collaborate with internal cross-agency teams and external industry representatives to ensure alignment and effective communication.
  • Prepare reports, background documents, correspondence, and meeting minutes. Manage follow-ups on pending tasks to ensure timely execution.
  • Assist in planning and implementing industry engagement activities or visits in alignment with the ISEP.

About You

The valuable knowledge and experience that you bring to this role is:

Business Situation Analysis

Investigates straightforward business situations to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.Contributes to the recommendation of improvements.Follows agreed standards and techniques to investigate, analyse and document business situations.Engages with stakeholders under direction.

Knowledge Management

Maintains a knowledge management database.Leverages knowledge of a specialism to capture and classify content, taking expert advice when required.

Research

Within given research goals, assists in selection and review of credible and reliable resources.Searches for relevant material using specialised websites and sources, reads relevant articles to update knowledge of the relevant field.Reports on work carried out and may contribute sections of publication-quality material.Curates, under guidance, a personal collection of relevant material.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible to apply for our internship program, you will need to meet the following criteria:

  • You are a national of a NATO member country
  • You are currently studying towards a university-level degree or have recently graduated in the past 12 months
  • A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable. Most of the work of the NCI Agency is conducted in the English language.

We also request that you please attach the following documents to your application form:

  • Copy of the university degree you have completed and/or
  • Proof of ongoing studies with the dates clearly mentioned if you are still studying

Application Process

The application process for an internship at NCIA is:

Ø Apply via the NCIA Careers site by 23:59 CET 16 th March 2025

Ø If selected to progress to the first stage evaluation this will consist of a logic, numeracy and behavioral gamification exercises in addition to on-demand video questions aligned to the requirements of the internship

Ø Virtual interviews will take place in the month of April

Ø Tentative offer to be presented to successful candidates in early May

Compensation

Belgium

You will be compensated at a fixed taxable rate of 1,286.09 EUR per month, based on 38 hours of work per week and for reasonable travel expenses to start on day 1 and to return to your home location once the internship is complete.

Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.To learn more about NCIA and our work, please visit our website .

NCIA prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCIA career site.

Title: CLIENT INSIGHTS DATA ANALYST
HTML:
About The Job

Within our Clienteling team, you will play a key role in transforming customer data into in-depth business analyses and strategic recommendations. Your main mission will be to detect opportunities for customer loyalty and engagement thanks to your mastery of data analysis and your sharp understanding of customer behavior.

Your Mission: Transform Data into Levers for Growth and Customer Loyalty

Job responsibilities

As a Client Insights Data Analyst, your mission will be to inform strategic decisions through your analytical expertise applied to customer data:

  • Conduct in-depth studies on the profile and behavior of our customers in both retail and e-retail.
  • Track customer trends and transform demographic, transactional, and engagement data into relevant insights and recommendations for business activations.
  • Measure commercial performance through precise KPIs and recommend areas for improvement.
  • Define and monitor precise KPIs to measure the performance of commercial actions and identify areas for improvement;
  • Contribute to the development of targeted Clienteling campaigns, monitor their implementation, and analyze their results;
  • Collaborate closely with business specialists from several departments to meet their needs for customer data analysis and optimize business opportunities;
  • Lead the network of regional correspondents in developing their customer knowledge: train them, provide them with simplified and automated reports, and support them in their ad hoc analyses;
  • Act as a proactive force for the Team Managers in developing the business and be a key contributor for sales, supporting teams on localized clienteling reporting and support with action plan, and regularly present your analyses and recommendations to the management teams;
  • Working together with Training team; leverage all the clienteling tools to engage and build long term Client relationships
  • Create and implement specific action plans to pro-actively drive the business
  • Reporting on client evolution and local clienteling KPIs on weekly/Monthly/quarterly basis for Front and DPCA teams;
  • Audience creation for EMEA wide and local activities for front and DPCA teams;
  • Clienteling Efficiency: collaborate with performance and experts' team to report accurate conversion for all clienteling campaigns
  • Managing Clienteling time with RTA based on the project and priorities;
  • Develop data visualizations that will allow monitoring performance;
  • Acting as Icons and Power BI project owner;
  • Coaching and training on tools-Icons device distribution and usage;
  • Streamlining internal requests processes and managing incoming Icons requests.

Profile

  • You have at least 3 years of similar experience;
  • Your analytical mind is your strength, combined with a sharp understanding of customer marketing;
  • Proven expertise in the daily use of SQL. Knowledge of Dataiku would be a plus;
  • Ability to present your analyses strategically orally and via PowerPoint;
  • You enjoy working in a team and being in direct contact with business teams. Interpersonal soft skills and ease in working daily with business contacts who are not data specialists;
  • Perfect command of English.

Reference LVM27257

Title: Industry Data Analyst Internship
Company: NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

16-Mar-2025, 10:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

1,286.09

Grade

INTERN

For more than 75 years, NATO’s mission has been to preserve peace and security in the Alliancefor nearly one billion citizens. The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) is NATO’s technology and cyber hub. We are a team of 3000 civilian and military staff, working together to connect all corners of NATO and maintain its Edge from 30 locations across the Alliance.

We are a key partner in NATO's Digital Transformation, working hand in hand with industry to provide technical solutions and expertise, facilitating political consultations and decision-making, and enabling multi-domain operations.

Our experts provide secure static and deployable communications infrastructure, satellite communications and information technology services, connected the Alliance’s forces, and strengthening NATO’s defence and deterrence posture. Fulfilling NCIA’s missions is possible because of our greatest force, our people. In order to reinforce NATO’s edge, we aim to hire, train and retain the very best staff.

Our staff members represent both the diversity and unity of our Alliance. When you join NCIA, you will be part of an organization where you can contribute authentically to the mission and purpose of NATO and help us ensure seamless connectivity among Allied partner nations.

About The Program

The NCIA internship is a 6-month program based at one of our key hubs in The Netherlands, Belgium or Portugal. Our internship opportunities start from either 1 March or 1 September with the start date being dependent on the timeline to secure the required security clearance to work within the NATO community. During an internship, you will join and support a diverse international team and simultaneously learn from our experts via on-the-job training, working independently on purposeful projects or initiatives during your tenure.

About The Internship

Internship duration: 6 months

Location: Brussels, Belgium

The Office of the Chief of Acquisition (COA) provides the full range of acquisition expertise and activities that support the planning, implementation and maintenance of the required capability in support to the Agency’s strategic goals and missions. These functions include Contracting and Acquisition Lifecycle, which includes Integrated Product Support and Cost Estimating and Analysis. COA controls all NCI Agency procurement activities to ensure effective risk management and protects the legal and financial liabilities of the Agency by implementing the best practices to all acquisition activities, including Lifecycle Acquisition.

This internship position is with Industry Relations Team (IRT), under Acquisition Office.IRT is responsible for advising the Chief of Acquisition and the NCIA General Manager on all Industry Relations matters to include strengthening existing relationships with the private sector and not-for-profit organizations as well as building new ones, in direct support of the Agency’s Strategic Plan.

Internship Duties:


Support the implementation of the Industry Strategic Engagement Plan (ISEP) through various tasks, primarily focusing on research, analysis and stakeholder engagement
Collect and analyse data from diverse sources (e.g., industry databases, surveys, open-source platforms) to support planning and reporting activities. Develop actionable, data-driven recommendations.
Present complex information in visually appealing formats tailored to different audiences and stakeholders.
Collaborate with internal cross-agency teams and external industry representatives to ensure alignment and effective communication.
Prepare reports, background documents, correspondence, and meeting minutes. Manage follow-ups on pending tasks to ensure timely execution.
Assist in planning and implementing industry engagement activities or visits in alignment with the ISEP.



About you:

The valuable knowledge and experience that you bring to this role is:

Business situation analysis :

Investigates straightforward business situations to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.Contributes to the recommendation of improvements.Follows agreed standards and techniques to investigate, analyse and document business situations.Engages with stakeholders under direction.

Knowledge management :

Maintains a knowledge management database.Leverages knowledge of a specialism to capture and classify content, taking expert advice when required.

Research :

Within given research goals, assists in selection and review of credible and reliable resources.Searches for relevant material using specialised websites and sources, reads relevant articles to update knowledge of the relevant field.Reports on work carried out and may contribute sections of publication-quality material.Curates, under guidance, a personal collection of relevant material.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible to apply for our internship program, you will need to meet the following criteria:


You are a national of a NATO member country
You are currently studying towards a university-level degree or have recently graduated in the past 12 months
A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable. Most of the work of the NCI Agency is conducted in the English language.



We also request that you please attach the following documents to your application form:


Copy of the university degree you have completed and/or
Proof of ongoing studies with the dates clearly mentioned if you are still studying



Application Process:

The application process for an internship at NCIA is:

Ø Apply via the NCIA Careers site by 23:59 CET 16 th March 2025

Ø If selected to progress to the first stage evaluation this will consist of a logic, numeracy and behavioral gamification exercises in addition to on-demand video questions aligned to the requirements of the internship

Ø Virtual interviews will take place in the month of April

Ø Tentative offer to be presented to successful candidates in early May

Compensation

Belgium

You will be compensated at a fixed taxable rate of 1,286.09 EUR per month, based on 38 hours of work per week and for reasonable travel expenses to start on day 1 and to return to your home location once the internship is complete.

Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.To learn more about NCIA and our work, please visit our website .

NCIA prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCIA career site.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Job Title: Data Analyst

📍 Location: Belgium, Hybrid

📝 Contract Type: Freelance

⏳ Contract Duration: 6 months +

💰 Daily Rate: Competitive, based on experience




What You’ll Do:

Analyse large datasets to identify patterns and insights
Build dashboards and reports to track key business metrics
Work with teams to improve decision-making using data-driven insights
Clean, structure, and optimize datasets for efficiency
Use statistical methods to test hypotheses and forecast trends




What You’ll Need:

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in SQL (querying, joins, optimization)
Strong skills in Python/R for data analysis
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
Knowledge of Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, VBA is a plus)
Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes
Understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and predictive modelling

Soft Skills:

Analytical mindset with attention to detail
Problem-solving approach to messy data
Strong communication skills to translate insights into action







Sodarec is an equal opportunity recruiter. All applications are considered based on skills and experience, without discrimination. While we appreciate every application, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our consulting client is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Brussels.




Experience in the Insurance industry is mandatory.




The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.




During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.




Responsibilities:




Data Collection and Processing
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Reporting and Presentation
Data-Driven Decision Making
Continuous Improvement and Learning




Your Skills:




We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
Tableau/Power BI, matplotlib
BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Drive Sustainability with Data (Immediate Consideration)




📍 Remote | Work from Anywhere (UK Time Zone)

💰 Salary: £40,000 - £55,000 (Up to £70,000 for Lead Role)

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available

📈 Career Growth – Opportunities for Progression in a High-Impact Industry

🌍 Make a Difference – Use Data to Tackle Climate Challenges




Are you passionate about using data to solve real-world problems? Do you want to contribute to a greener future while working in a fast-paced, forward-thinking environment? We’re a mission-driven sustainability company using technology and data to create a cleaner, more sustainable world. Now, we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the future of sustainability.




What You’ll Do

Analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends in carbon emissions, renewable energy, waste reduction, and sustainability initiatives.
Develop insightful dashboards and reports to help businesses and policymakers make data-driven environmental decisions.
Work closely with sustainability experts, engineers, and product teams to turn data into actionable insights.
Design and refine predictive models to assess environmental impact and forecast sustainability outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy, quality, and integrity, helping build reliable climate impact metrics.
Stay up to date with industry trends and contribute ideas to improve sustainability strategies.




What We’re Looking For

Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, R, or similar tools.
Proficiency in data visualisation platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Understanding of statistical methods and predictive modelling.
Passion for sustainability and an interest in climate data, energy systems, or ESG reporting.
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous experience in data analysis, sustainability, or a related field (preferred but not required).




Why Join?

🌍 Mission-Driven Work – Contribute to real, measurable environmental change.

💼 100% Remote & Flexible – Work from anywhere while following UK time zones.

📈 Career Growth – Be part of a company at the cutting edge of sustainable innovation.

🎓 Learning & Development – Access training, certifications, and mentorship opportunities.

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available – We welcome global talent to drive our mission forward.

🏝 Generous Holiday Allowance – Enjoy a proper work-life balance with up to 38 days of paid leave.

❤️ Wellness & Mental Health Support – We prioritise your well-being.




This isn’t just another data role—it’s a chance to make a real impact in the fight against climate change. If you're passionate about sustainability and thrive in a data-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now – Let’s build a greener future together! 🌱

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analysing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modelling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.




About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more
HTML:
Permanent position only


WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.


CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

  • 1/3 of Personal development
  • 1/3 of Collective Intelligence
  • 1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)


WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.


YOUR TASKS :

  • You understand the business request
  • You dive into a large amount of data :
  1. Collecting and interpreting data
  2. Analyzing results
  3. Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
  4. Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
  • You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
  • In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data


HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

  • You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
  • You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
  • You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
  • You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
  • You pay attention to details
  • You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset


WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

  • A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
  • You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
  • You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
  • You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
  • We have values we share, live with and experiment every day


We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!


"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

NCIA, as the main ICT service provider in NATO, is the main technical entity providing subject matter expertise to support Allied Command Transformation (ACT) Science and Technology (S&T), NATO Digital Staff (NDS) Innovation Programmes of Work (PoW) and relevant exercises in 2025. NCIA Chief Technology Office (CTO) Innovating Team is looking for a Contractor who will provide day-to-day technical support to the PoW projects with the two NATO bodies.

Role Duties And Responsibilities

Under the direction / guidance of the NCIA Point of Contact or delegated staff, they will perform the following activities:


Support NCI Agency in the NATO Programmes of Work with ACT and NDS in the area of Science & Technology and Innovation
Gather and analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources, including scientific publications, news articles, social media, and market reports
Perform horizon scanning and trend-scouting activities in the area of emerging and disruptive technologies by detecting promising technologies as well as potential applications
Design and implement data models, repositories, and ETL pipelines to capture and record signals from diverse sources as a structured dataset to enable ad-hoc analysis and reporting
Develop clear, concise, and actionable reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders across the organization
Develop dashboards to enable monitoring of the analysis results
Utilize natural language processing (NLP) and other AI techniques to analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources


Essential Skills And Experience


At least five years of experience in a mid-level data analytics role
Strong understanding of AI and its potential applications in data analysis – particularly Natural language processing (NLP) techniques, language models and multilingual technologies.
Strong programming, data modelling, and data visualization skills, including Python, SQL, PowerBI, R, TensorFlow and NoSQL DBs.
Experience with Extract, Transform, Load tools and techniques integrating with REST APIs and document management systems.
Proven experience with technology horizon scanning techniques and identification of technology trends and high potential use-cases.
Proven experience with media monitoring, media data analysis, threat analysis in text and text classification.
Proven experience with software/tool development in the area of strategic foresight analysis and horizon scanning.
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills particularly as applied to trend scouting and innovation management


Desirable Skills And Experience


Relevant experience with NATO and/or international organizations is highly desired.


Education


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (computer science, data science, software engineering, machine learning, etc.) or equivalent experience.


Working Location


Remote


Working Policy


Off-Site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance


We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.
