Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Show more

  1. Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
  2. Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
  4. Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
  5. Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
  6. Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
  7. Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
  8. Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
  9. Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
A rapidly growing company is seeking an experienced Data Analyst / Power BI Expert to join the Business Intelligence team. In this role, you'll transform complex datasets into valuable insights and develop advanced Power BI solutions that empower data-driven decision-making. The position is based in Brussels.

Responsibilities

Power BI Development:

Create and manage advanced Power BI reports and dashboards, utilizing sophisticated DAX functions, calculations, and data models.
Optimize report performance for large datasets to ensure efficient data processing and visualization.
Implement security measures like row-level security to maintain data confidentiality.
Develop and maintain custom visuals and extensions to enhance reporting capabilities.

Data Analysis and Visualization:

Analyze diverse, large datasets to identify key trends and insights.
Design clear, impactful data visualizations that effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure accuracy and reliability.

Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing:

Work closely with data engineers for seamless data processing and preparation.
Mentor junior analysts on Power BI best practices and advanced techniques.
Contribute to team knowledge-sharing initiatives and support collective growth.

Your Profile

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science or Statistics.
At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on Power BI.
Experience working with complex data environments, such as data warehousing and big data.
Extensive knowledge of data modeling techniques, including star schema and dimensional modeling.

Technical Skills:

Expert in Power BI (both Desktop and Service), including advanced DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
Strong SQL skills and experience with various database systems.
Familiar with optimization techniques for Power BI reports and dashboards.
Knowledgeable in data security best practices within Power BI.

Personal Skills:

Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills for conveying data insights clearly.
Independent worker, but also a collaborative team player.
Passionate about continuous learning and data.

Bonus Points:

Experience with other data visualization tools (such as Tableau or Qlik Sense).
Familiarity with programming languages like Python or R.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure or AWS).
Microsoft Power BI certification.

What We Offer

Permanent, full-time contract
Dynamic work environment within an innovative and fast-growing organization
Autonomy and entrepreneurship within your role
Results-oriented management with room for personal input
Competitive salary based on experience and responsibilities
Opportunities for professional and personal development

Are you ready for a new challenge in an inspiring environment? We look forward to your application!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij geïnteresseerd in data en data-analyse? Heb jij een sterk analytisch vermogen en hou je ervan om zorgvuldig te werken? Wil jij jouw steentje bijdragen in het uitbouwen van infrastructuurprojecten? Dan ben jij misschien dé data analist die wij bij het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare Werken nodig hebben! We zijn op zoek naar een werkkracht die graag de schouders onder dataprojecten over wegenis, bruggen, tunnels, tramsporen, sluizen en kaaimuren wil zetten.




Jouw takenpakket

Je verzamelt, schoont op, verrijkt en structureert technische en economische data.
Je combineert technische en economische data om kengetallen en modellen te creëren zodat infrastructuurprojecten sneller en accurater geraamd kunnen worden.
Je analyseert de data om opportuniteiten te zien en inzichten te verwerven vanuit het standpunt van de investeerder in openbare infrastructuur.
Je visualiseert de data door middel van rapporten en dashboards.
Je publiceert rapporten en dashboards.
Je beheert rapporten en dashboards, zoals het monitoren van hun correct functioneren en van de nauwkeurigheid.




Je werkt onder meer samen met de celcoördinator, de cost engineer, de Coördinator MEDIAAN, de business projectleiders van DMOW en de verschillende ICT-collega’s en -betrokkenen (ICT-chiefarchitect, informatici, ICT-projectleiders, DPO, dataspecialist, GIS-specialist). De focus zal hier voornamelijk op het verzamelen, verwerken, analyseren en visualiseren van economische en technische data liggen. Zo word je betrokken bij verschillende infrastructuurprojecten zoals het aanleggen of vernieuwen van wegenis, bruggen, tunnels, tramsporen, sluizen en kaaimuren.




Ben jij de data analist die we zoeken?

Je beschikt minstens over een bachelordiploma.
Je hebt minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analyst, reporting analyst of data scientist. Je hebt praktische ervaring met gebruik van Microsoft-applicaties en -platformen, zoals Excel en Power BI, om data te bewerken, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Je beschikt over uitstekende praktische ICT-vaardigheden.
Je gaat vlot om met digitale toepassingen (o.a. webapplicaties).
Je kan goed aan de slag met de applicaties van Microsoft Office 365.
Je hebt goede kritische analytische vaardigheden en je bent nieuwsgierig en toegewijd om problemen op te lossen en verbanden te leggen of oorzaken te zien.
Je hebt een sterke wiskundige basis (statistiek, modellering) en interesse in data-analyse en modellering.
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands.

Pluspunten

Je hebt kennis van R en/of Python of basiskennis van Matlab, VB.NET of aanverwante software)




Werken via Vlaanderen Connect

Je wordt tewerkgesteld via Vlaanderen Connect, de ICT strategische dienstverlener van de Vlaamse overheid. Bij Vlaanderen Connect. wordt je voor onbepaalde duur ter beschikking gesteld aan het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare werken, hierbij ontvang je een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Werken voor Vlaanderen Connect. betekent werken in een organisatie met boeiende en uitdagende IT functies én de mogelijkheid om mee je schouders te zetten in het uitbouwen van een digitaal en slagkrachtig Vlaanderen.




Verder biedt werken voor Vlaanderen Connect tal van voordelen. Je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je meewerken aan een digitale en slagkrachtige overheid, voor burgers en ondernemers. Daarnaast kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen Connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Aanbod

Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:

een mobiliteitsbudget
maaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)
een hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)
een groepsverzekering
mogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.




Bij Vlaanderen connect is een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé belangrijk: een werkweek van 38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12). Verder zijn er flexibele werkuren en je kan thuiswerken.




Ten slotte krijg je bij Vlaanderen connect nog verschillende andere voordelen: je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Nieuwsgierig?

Bekijk de volledige vacature op https://www.vlaanderen.be/werken-voor-vlaanderen/vacatures/data-analist-dmow-via-vlaanderen-connect-d36980. Neem zeker eens een kijkje in het selectiereglement waarin een praktisch voorbeeld staat uitgeschreven en wat jouw rol als data analist kan zijn.




Overtuigd?!

Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatieknop!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.




Your job responsibilities:




Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.




Your Requirements:




Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.




We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.
Show more
HTML:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 

  • You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
  • You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
  • You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
  • Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
  • You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
  • You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
  • You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.

Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst

  • You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
  • You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
  • You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
  • You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
  • You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
  • You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
  • You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).

Notre offre

  • A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
  • An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
  • In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
  • An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
  • Location : Brussels.
  • Up to 46 days of leave per year.
  • Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.

Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant







Permanent contract




FR or NL +EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.

We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You’ll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.




Check out some of our ongoing projects:




Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.




If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if they match your profile!




Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:




Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.




Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills:

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch+ English.




Your technical experience:

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.




Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid way of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances…




Apply now

We can’t wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
🔎 Quantitative Analyst




Join a dynamic team at the forefront of energy trading! We’re looking for a Quantitative Analyst to support robust and high-performance quantitative tools that drive real business impact.




Tasks




✔ Collaborate closely with traders to enhance pricing frameworks and risk management strategies

✔ Develop new pricing models and trading strategies for energy markets

✔ Implement best coding practices and contribute to the official pricing library

✔ Deliver tactical and strategic quantitative solutions




Skills




🔹 Strong background in Financial Mathematics (stochastic calculus, Monte Carlo, PDEs, etc.)

🔹 Proficiency in C#, Python, or similar languages

🔹 Ability to explain complex models in a clear, actionable way

🔹 Master’s or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or Financial Engineering

🔹 Experience in commodity markets is a plus

📍 Fluency in English

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
📢 We’re Hiring: Digital Analytics Specialist

Are you passionate about digital business and data-driven insights? We’re looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist to join our team and help us analyze customer behavior while optimizing our websites and apps.

Your Responsibilities

✅ Manage and maintain web analytics implementations for websites and apps

✅ Ensure consistent tracking, analysis, and reporting of key website KPIs

✅ Detect trends in online behavior across pre-sales, sales, servicing, and support

✅ Translate business requirements into tagging guidelines

✅ Develop dashboards in Adobe Analytics and conduct proactive analyses

🎓 Experience: 2-5 years in digital analytics

📊 Strong experience with Adobe Analytics dashboards & data layer recommendations

💡 Familiarity with Google Analytics, Looker Studio, and Contentsquare




Who You Are

✔️ Able to work independently and take initiative

✔️ Passionate about digital business and analytics

✔️ Motivated and eager to learn

Practical Details

📍 Location: Hybrid (2 days/week on-site)

🚀 Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join a dynamic environment where data drives decisions!

Title: Data Analyst - ETL Development
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst Engineer (ETL Developer)

Purpose: Translate and analyze business requirements, design & update data models with both functional and technical intake within the Data Warehouse project as a primary focus.

Responsibilities:

Align features with projects, teams, and applications.
Create a functional analysis that enables the development team to implement user stories.
Analyze existing systems and highlight areas for improvement.
Create procedures and packages to meet the ETL requirements, including testing.
Conduct performance analysis to optimize the impact on operational systems.
Contribute to master data management projects and provide feedback on data flows.
Engage in the Data Team for sharing knowledge & work in close collaboration with the architects.

Requirements:

Hard Skills:

Higher education degree with at least 5 years of experience in business and/or functional analysis and as an ETL Developer.
Expertise in collecting, analyzing, and documenting business and functional requirements.
Experience working in large and complex projects with many stakeholders.
Profound knowledge of T-SQL scripting & querying.
Knowledge of the MS SQL stack (DB - SSIS - SSRS) on 2019 and 2022 releases, Standard Edition.
Knowledge of Azure and Databricks.
Experience in implementing solutions with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) & its ETL capabilities.
Strong experience in Data warehousing (DataVault, ...)
Knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
Big data (Hadoop, ...), pipeline orchestration, log collection & distribution tools are a plus.
Finance & Risk knowledge (mainly in reporting area, ex Solvency II, BGAAP, IFRS4/9/17).
Experience in Agile or SCRUM practices is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch/English or French/English.

Soft Skills:

Analytical mind, well-organized, and result-driven.
Focus on details.
Sense of initiative and a real team player.
Ability to follow up on development and link development to requirements.
Ability to work together with PM to construct a roadmap to deliver required BI systems according to requirements.
Ability to work in various fields and keep up to date with technological developments in the market.
Working knowledge of data and process modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
Great communication skills.
Organizational and presentation skills.
Interpersonal and teamwork skills.

Additional Skills for All Levels:

Intellectual/Analytical Ability: Develops estimating and planning skills, is well-organized, and can manage time effectively.
Sense of Reality: Accepts responsibility for dedicated work packages and strives for on-time delivery.
Innovation/Initiative: Escalates issues or problems early, takes necessary actions to get things done or moving, and demonstrates a proactive attitude.
Show more

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Deine Aufgaben




Du erstellst aussagekräftige Berichte und Analysen für interne und externe Stakeholder und pflegst sowie optimierst produktspezifische Informationen zu bestehenden Versicherungsmodellen
Du überwachst Key Performance Indikatoren (KPIs) in Power BI, analysierst Auffälligkeiten und leitest geeignete Maßnahmen ab
Du bearbeitest servicebezogene Anfragen aus internen Abteilungen und von externen Partnern im Zusammenhang mit Services und Prozessen
Du prüfst und validierst die IT-seitige Codierung von Verrechnungsprozessen und analysierst neue oder geänderte Prozesse hinsichtlich ihrer Abrechenbarkeit und Integration in bestehende Systeme
Du unterstützt bei der Implementierung neuer Tarife für medizinische Dienstleistungen




Dein Profil




Abgeschlossenes Studium (präferiert) oder eine abgeschlossene Lehre in einem relevanten Bereich wie Betriebswirtschaft, Datenanalyse Gesundheitsmanagement oder Versicherungswesen
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Datenanalyse, Controlling oder Service-Management, idealerweise im Versicherungs- oder Gesundheitswesen
Fundierte Kenntnisse der TARDOC/TARMED Tarifstrukturen
Erfahrung im Umgang mit KPI-Monitoring-Tools wie Power BI
Kundenorientierte Arbeitsweise mit Fokus auf Servicequalität sowie sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift




Das bietet unser Partner




Eine vielseitige und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit mit großem Gestaltungsspielraum in einem motivierten, interdisziplinären Team
Flexible Arbeitsmodelle mit der Möglichkeit, bis zu 3 Tagen/ Woche aus dem HO zu arbeiten
Ein modernes, top ausgestattetes Büro mit guter Erreichbarkeit sowohl mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln als auch mit dem Auto (Parkplätze vorhanden)

Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Title: Junior IT Engineer- Fresh Graduates Program
Description:
Start your career with Huawei’s Fresh Graduate Program

Job Title

Junior IT Engineer (m/f/d) – Graduate Program

Job Location:

Zurich, Switzerland

Main Responsibilities

You will be part of the Huawei Switzerland Delivery & Service team and support them in all tasks

Establish IT environment by designing system configuration; directing system installation; defining, documenting, and enforcing system standards

Configure and integrate storage, virtualization, cloud (e.g., SAN, NAS, S3, Virtualization, Cloud)

Perform IT maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes, and security configurations

Provide support and troubleshooting to resolve issues

Participate in various channel technology activities and enable Huawei channel partners

Requirements

Recently graduated (2024-2025) from a technical university, preferably Telecommunications or Computer Science.

First work experience or internships in the IT Infrastructure area is preferred

Understanding of Switzerland’s ICT industry

Self-motivated, proactive and target-oriented

High flexibility and ability to manage multiple tasks

Ability to work in a culturally diverse, high-paced organization

Fluent in English and German is a must; further languages are an advantage

Please note that in order to be considered for this position, candidates must have work authorization in Switzerland, be a graduate from a bachelor or masters in 2024-2025 and speak English and German. All applications that do not meet these minimum requirements will not be considered for this program.

Graduate Program In Switzerland

We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest-growing multinational telecommunication companies

Personal Development is ensured through training and workshop opportunities throughout the first six months

Firsthand experience in customer engagement and new technology innovation

Challenging and diverse assignments that enable you to develop your personal and professional strengths continuously

Competitive Salary package

Mentor/Buddy Program: A mentor that will guide you through both business and intercultural development

After onboarding, internal networking activities with other fresh Graduates take place regularly

About Huawei

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices provider. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have over 207,000 employees and operate in more than 170 countries and regions.

Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions, and services is competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.
Show more

Main Responsibilities

You will be part of the Huawei Switzerland Delivery & Service team and support them in all tasks

Establish IT environment by designing system configuration; directing system installation; defining, documenting, and enforcing system standards

Configure and integrate storage, virtualization, cloud (e.g., SAN, NAS, S3, Virtualization, Cloud)

Perform IT maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes, and security configurations

Provide support and troubleshooting to resolve issues

Participate in various channel technology activities and enable Huawei channel partners

Requirements

Recently graduated (2024-2025) from a technical university, preferably Telecommunications or Computer Science.

First work experience or internships in the IT Infrastructure area is preferred

Understanding of Switzerland’s ICT industry

Self-motivated, proactive and target-oriented

High flexibility and ability to manage multiple tasks

Ability to work in a culturally diverse, high-paced organization

Fluent in English and German is a must; further languages are an advantage

Please note that in order to be considered for this position, candidates must have work authorization in Switzerland, be a graduate from a bachelor or masters in 2024-2025 and speak English and German. All applications that do not meet these minimum requirements will not be considered for this program.

Graduate Program In Switzerland

We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest-growing multinational telecommunication companies

Personal Development is ensured through training and workshop opportunities throughout the first six months

Firsthand experience in customer engagement and new technology innovation

Challenging and diverse assignments that enable you to develop your personal and professional strengths continuously

Competitive Salary package

Mentor/Buddy Program: A mentor that will guide you through both business and intercultural development

After onboarding, internal networking activities with other fresh Graduates take place regularly

About Huawei

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices provider. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have over 207,000 employees and operate in more than 170 countries and regions.

Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions, and services is competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.

Title: Market Analyst
Description:
For motivated candidates we offer the chance to belong to one of the top producers and marketers of commodities and to be part of a specialized, international and diverse team within the Ferroalloys / Nickel Department.

The Main Tasks And Responsibilities Include


Collecting, compiling, analysing, and presenting quantitative and qualitative data on the global Nickel market, Stainless Steel, Batteries, and Ferroalloy markets
Maintaining and developing a structured approach to the storage and analysis of statistical information, including supply, demand and trade data, stock movements, macroeconomic indicators, and cost of production models
Assimilating information sourced from the company’s extensive network of field offices and from external industry sources and contacts
Identifying market trends and economic developments affecting the international Nickel, Stainless Steel, and Ferroalloy markets, and to provide real time feedback and ideas on the markets to the relevant trading teams in Baar
Developing and maintaining internal technical reports and models


The ideal candidate


has advanced analytical skills
has a high level of personal credibility, with the authority to build respect and trust at all levels of a company
is team-oriented and collaborative
has a genuine interest in building and sustaining positive relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
has a good ability to navigate complexity and act strategically, along with a readiness to accommodate shifting priorities


Qualifications And Requirements


A degree or equivalent qualification an applicable/related field
1-3 years of experience in an analytical or business intelligence role preferred, but not a requirement. Graduates with the right demonstrable skills may also be considered
Analytical skills, with the ability to review data, spot trends and identify key drivers
Good IT skills including standard applications, operating systems, databases, Excel
Advanced presentation, research, and verbal / written communication skills
Fluent in English spoken and written (corporate language)
Holding a Swiss work permit or passport holder of CH / EU


Benefits


We are committed to providing benefits, which promote mental, physical, and financial well-being. From healthy meal options in our restaurants and bistros to free use of the in-house gym including sport classes with professional trainers.
We reimburse public transport for commuting to work; alternatively, we offer free parking space.
We provide tuition assistance for further education and training courses.
We have a competitive parental leave policy. Our childcare benefits also include emergency childcare services and financial assistance towards daycare costs.
Employees’ Swiss Pension 2nd pillar is fully paid by Glencore.


Who We Are

Glencore is one of the world’s largest global diversified natural resource companies and a major producer and marketer of more than 60 commodities that advance everyday life. Through a network of assets, customers and suppliers that spans the globe, we produce, process, recycle, source, market and distribute the commodities that support decarbonisation while meeting the energy needs of today.

With over 150,000 employees and contractors and a strong footprint in over 35 countries in both established and emerging regions for natural resources, our marketing and industrial activities are supported by a global network of more than 50 offices.

Glencore’s customers are industrial consumers, such as those in the automotive, steel, power generation, battery manufacturing and oil sectors. We also provide financing, logistics and other services to producers and consumers of commodities.

Glencore is proud to be a member of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the International Council on Mining and Metals. We are an active participant in the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative.

We will support the global effort to achieve the goals of the Paris Agreement through our efforts to decarbonise our own operational footprint. We believe that we should take a holistic approach and have considered our commitment through the lens of our global industrial emissions. Against a restated 2019 baseline, we are targeting to reduce our Scope 1, 2 and 3 industrial emissions by 15% by the end of 2026, 25% by the end of 2030, 50% by the end of 2035 and we have an ambition to achieve net zero industrial emissions by the end of 2050, subject to a supportive policy environment. For more information see our 2024-2026 Climate Action Transition Plan and the About our emissions calculation and reporting section in our 2023 Annual Report, available on our website at glencore.com/publications.

Note*: All applications will be subject to potential background checks. You will be informed if this will be the case. Further information about the processing of your personal data will be made available during the application process. We'll seek your explicit consent prior to processing the data.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer - Hive, Kafka, Cloudera, Data Modelling
Description:
Data Analytics Engineer - Hive, Kafka, Cloudera, Data Modelling - vacancy for our Basel based client in the Banking sector.

Your tasks:

Develop code for end-to-end data pipelines
Loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed design
Support on data-related technical issues and data needs


Your experience/knowledge:


Experienced Data Analytics Engineer (Strong Data Modelling)
Development expertise on using open-source data technologies such as Hive, Spark and Kafka preferably with Cloudera.
Hadoop, HBase, Impala, ELK, are highly desirable
Strong Python development skills
Expertise in building data ingestion pipelines for data warehouse and/or data lake architecture
Strong experience in data modelling, design patterns, and building highly scalable applications
Language skills: English

Your soft skills:


Excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
A high degree of self-organisation and time management
Analytical and solution-orientated thinking




Location:Basel, Switzerland
Work setting:Hybrid
Sector:Banking
Start:ASAP or 05/2025
Duration:6 months +
Workload:100%
Ref.Nr.:BH 22669



Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.
Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.
Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.
We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: DATA ENGINEER
Description:
Expleo bietet ein einzigartiges Angebot an integrierten Dienstleistungen in den Bereichen Engineering, Qualität und strategische Beratung für die digitale Transformation. Vor dem Hintergrund einer beispiellosen technologischen Beschleunigung sind wir der vertrauenswürdige Partner für innovative Unternehmen. Wir helfen ihnen, einen Wettbewerbsvorteil zu entwickeln und das tägliche Leben von Millionen von Menschen zu verbessern.

Zu Expleo Switzerland Gehören 19.000 Mitarbeiter In 32 Ländern Mit Einem Umsatz Von 1,4 Mrd. €, Aber Auch


Eine technische und menschliche Begleitung bei jedem Projekt und eine leistungsfähige Betreuung Ihrer Karriere zu haben.
Teilnahme an Schulungen, um Ihre beruflichen Fähigkeiten weiterzuentwickeln.
An speziellen Veranstaltungen teilnehmen.
Integration in ein dynamisches Team.


Als Teil eines interdisziplinären, agilen Teams, das die Erneuerungen im technischen Bereich vorantreibt, suchen wir in der Region Bern eine/n DATA ENGINEER.

Responsibilities


Optimierung und Pflege der bestehenden Dateninfrastruktur für Performance und Skalierbarkeit. Entwurf und Implementierung von ETL- zur Datenintegration aus verschiedenen Quellen.Entwicklung und Support mit MSSQL sowie ETL-Entwicklung mit SSIS.
Implementierung von Datenqualitätschecks und Monitoring-Mechanismen zur Sicherstellung der Datenintegrität.
Dokumentation von Datenarchitektur, Prozessen und technischen Entscheidungen.
Erstellung Datenmodelle im ESD/BI-Bereich mit dimensionalem Modellieren und Data Vault 2.0 Modellierung im Management Studio.


Essential Skills


Höhere Ausbildung / Studium im Bereich DATA ENGINEERING
Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in data engineering.
Gute Beherrschung in Visual Studio SQL,Server Management Studio Tools
Erfahrung im ESD/BI-Bereich mit Dimensional Modeling und Data Vault 2.0 Modeling
Englisch und Deutsch fließend
Show more

Title: Praktikum im Bereich Data & Analytics
Description:
Hast du ein Flair für Daten und Analysen und möchtest aktiv an der Gestaltung der datengetriebenen Zukunft von Edelweiss teilnehmen? Dann könnte unser Jahrespraktikum (12 Monate) ab August oder September 2025 genau das Richtige für dich sein!

Aufgaben

Du unterstützt das Data & Analytics Competence Center in sämtlichen Bereichen der Zentralisierung des Datamanagements. Neben der Erstellung von standardisierten Dashboards in Power BI wirkst du auch bei der Erschliessung von neuen Datenquellen mit.

Zudem bist du verantwortlich für:


Testing von umgesetzten Business Requirements und Change Requests für aktuelle Data Warehouse Lösungen
Dokumentation der Datenquellen und Datendefinitionen
Mitarbeit bei der Erarbeitung und Umsetzung von Data Analytics Use Cases
Unterstützung bei der Weiterentwicklung von Prozessen und der Organisation im Bereich Data & Analytics


Benefits


Modernes Office
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitmodelle
Ortsungebundene Arbeit (z.B. Home Office)
Reisevergünstigungen
Rabatte
Vergünstigte Parkmöglichkeiten oder ÖV


Voraussetzungen

Für diese Position wird ein Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften (VWL, BWL) oder einem ähnlichen Bereich vorausgesetzt. Erste Erfahrungen im Bereich Business Intelligence oder Data & Analytics sind von Vorteil.

Was bringst du sonst noch mit:


Du verfügst über ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, eine Affinität für Zahlen, eine präzise Arbeitsweise und ein vernetztes Denkvermögen
Als flexibler und zuverlässiger Teamplayer mit einem starken Dienstleistungsverständnis bist du gut in der Lage selbständig und kontinuierlich zur Weiterentwicklung deines Verantwortungsbereichs beizutragen
Fliessende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie umfassende Erfahrung mit Microsoft 365 sind unerlässlich, insbesondere in Excel und BI-Tools. Programmierkenntnisse sind von Vorteil


Über uns

Als führende Ferienfluggesellschaft der Schweiz fliegen wir unsere Gäste an die schönsten Traumziele der Welt. Inspiriert durch eine offene Kultur der Wertschätzung, Begeisterung und Professionalität bieten wir unseren Gästen aus aller Welt herausragende, überraschende, schweizerische Produkt- und Servicequalität.

Kontakt

Katrin Aerni

recruiting@flyedelweiss.com

+41 43 456 50 55
Show more

Title: Sales Controller, Sales Data Analyst (m/f/d) 100%
Description:
Our client GC International AG is one of the leading companies in the development, production, and distribution of a very wide range of oral healthcare and dentistry products. Since its beginning, GC has always embraced innovation and ensured the production of high-quality, pioneering products and services. For its global sales management team, we are looking for an




Sales Controller, Sales Data Analyst (m/f/d) 100%




In this newly created role, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting sales data from various regions, including Europe, USA, Asia, and Japan. Your primary focus will be on enhancing the transparency and accuracy of the sales reporting. You will work closely with regional sales teams and other stakeholders to consolidate data and provide actionable insights.

As Sales Controller, you can analyze complex data sets and use data systems (ERP) to gain actionable insights that support strategic decision making around pricing and sales performance.




Main Responsibilities




Data Analysis: Analyze sales data from data systems (SAP, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel) to identify trends, pricing strategies, and margins.
Reporting: Prepare monthly and quarterly reports for the board, focusing on KPIs and sales analytics.
System Development: Further develop the ERP and reporting systems to create a unified and transparent reporting structure.
Collaboration: Work closely with peers in regional organizations and other stakeholders to gather and consolidate data.
Team Management: Supervise and guide a junior Sales Coordinator in data collection and consolidation.




Your Qualifications

Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field.
Relevant experience in finance, sales analysis, or controlling.
Experience working in an intercultural environment.
Experience in project management.




What we are looking for:




Analytical Mindset: Strong affinity for numbers and structured work approach.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Excel. Familiarity with ERP systems, particularly SAP.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders; capable of enforcing transparency and cooperation from regional organizations.
Pragmatic and Detail-Oriented: Focused on continuous improvement and optimizing processes and tools.
Independent and Self-Motivated: Highly independent and driven by the challenge of optimizing systems and processes.




Do you want to become part of an international company with more than 100 years of commitment and legacy for dental and oral care innovations? Join the team on a transformative journey where innovation meets data-driven success. In this role, you thrive in an intercultural, international environment and can make a significant impact on sales analytics and price strategies.







GC International AG is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates.




Please send us your application documents by email to backoffice@debord.ch, for the attention of Ms. Andrea Nienaber, Managing Partner DE BORD INTERNATIONAL. Discretion is a matter of course.







DE BORD INTERNATIONAL • Zürichbergstrasse 38 • CH-8044 Zürich • Telefon +41 44 382 17 17 • backoffice@debord.ch • www.debord.ch • www.lladvisorygroup.com

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Stagiaire Business insights analyst Intern
Description:
About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

Position Overview:

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.

Key Responsibilities:



Data Management and Relationship Building:
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Data Analysis and Recommendations:
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Reporting Excellence:
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyzed data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Dashboard Maintenance:
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Support and Collaboration:
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Internship agreement required
Starting Date :1st July 2025



Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !
Show more

Title: Data Engineer - Databricks (M/F/O)
Description:
Mission

Akkodis est un leader mondial dans le domaine de l'ingénierie et de la R&D, exploitant la puissance des données connectées pour accélérer l'innovation et la transformation numérique. Avec une passion commune pour la technologie et les talents, 50 000 ingénieurs et experts numériques offrent une expertise transversale dans 30 pays à travers l'Amérique du Nord, la région EMEA et la région APAC.




Akkodis offre une large expérience industrielle et un savoir-faire solide dans des secteurs technologiques clés tels que la mobilité, les services logiciels et technologiques, la robotique, les tests, les simulations, la sécurité des données, l'IA et l'analyse des données. La combinaison de l'expertise en IT et en ingénierie offre une solution de bout en bout unique, avec quatre lignes de service – Consulting, Solutions, Talents et Academy – pour aider nos clients à repenser le développement de leurs produits et leurs processus commerciaux, améliorer la productivité, réduire le temps de mise sur le marché et façonner un avenir plus intelligent et plus durable. Akkodis fait partie du groupe Adecco.




Contexte




Akkodis recrute, pour le compte de son client, un Ingénieur Data avec une expertise en Databricks. Ce poste s’inscrit dans un environnement Agile, où le candidat contribuera à l’intégration et à l’optimisation des flux de données, tout en garantissant leur qualité et leur performance.




Responsabilités




• Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données en utilisant Databricks.

• Intégrer et transformer des données provenant de multiples sources, en assurant leur cohérence et leur accessibilité.

• Implémenter des solutions de virtualisation des données avec Databricks pour optimiser l’accès en temps réel.

• Collaborer avec les Data Analysts, Data Scientists et équipes métiers pour répondre aux besoins analytiques.

• Garantir la qualité, la fiabilité et la gouvernance des données, en suivant les meilleures pratiques du secteur.

• Optimiser la performance des requêtes et des traitements de données en appliquant des techniques avancées (push-down processing, caching, indexation).




Compétences et expérience requises




• 10 ans d’expérience en tant qu’Ingénieur Data.

• Expérience avec Databricks (Spark, SQL, Python).

• Bonne compréhension des architectures de traitement et de gestion des données (ETL/ELT, virtualisation, pipelines de données).

• Expérience dans un environnement Agile (Scrum/Kanban).

• Capacité à optimiser et industrialiser les traitements de données.

• Fort esprit analytique et capacité à travailler en équipe.




Qualifications




• Diplôme en Informatique, Data Engineering ou domaine connexe.

• Expérience confirmée en Databricks

• Une certification Databricks est un plus.

Show more

Title: AI Engineer/Researcher Intern
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Your internship

Join our cutting-edge AI internship program and gain hands-on experience tackling real-world challenges in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Depending on the project, you will develop and optimize agentic AI systems, fine-tune open-source LLMs, enhance existing models with techniques like quantization and distillation, build gen-ai applications that produce actionable insights, or explore advanced methods such as reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) and direct preference optimization (DPO). This internship offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, equipping you with the skills to make a real-world impact.

What You Will Do


Collaborate with Experts: Work closely with AI/ML researchers and software engineers to develop and optimize state-of-the-art AI applications.
Innovate with Latest Technologies: Conduct research and experiments leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, commercial and open source to find the best approach.
Contribute to Development: Actively participate in evaluation, integration, and deployment of your solution in the nexthink platform.
Communicate Your Insights: Present your findings and recommendations to the team and key stakeholders.


Qualifications


MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, ML or a relevant field
You have a good understanding of AI/ML, NLP, and LLM technologies and hands-on experience with software engineering.
We expect most of the work to be done in Python. Knowledge of Java, Docker, and microservice technologies is a plus.
You should possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills, a good team spirit, and the ability to collaborate efficiently.
You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Professional level of written and spoken English skills are a must.
