Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to ‘Connect the world’. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

Job Description Summary

The Global Office of Transformation at Vialto Partners has the mission to continuously optimize our delivery model and business processes, leveraging our people, technology and scale as a global enterprise. We are obsessed with driving value for our clients, assignees and employees.

Your pivotal role revolves around applying your expertise in data interpretation & manipulation to transform complex datasets into actionable insights. You will take the lead in automating routine tasks, deploying scalable tools across the organization, and enabling the organization to make faster, more informed decisions, all while driving growth and innovation.

Job Description

Data Analysis


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights for business decisions in the form of dashboards & business intelligence products
Utilize statistical tools and software to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies
Assist in optimizing business operations through data analysis
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports and analyses
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analytics


Self-service Automation


Design, develop, and maintain self-service automation solutions that allow users to independently manage tasks and access data with minimal manual intervention
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities that improve user experience and operational workflows
Create user-friendly interfaces for automation tools, ensuring accessibility and ease of use for non-technical users
Implement automation solutions that integrate with various applications
Monitor and troubleshoot the performance of self-service automation tools, ensuring high availability and minimal disruptions
Develop training materials & documentation to empower users to take full advantage of self-service tools
Continuously analyze automation processes and feedback to improve functionality and user satisfaction
Stay updated with the latest automation technologies and best practices to continuously enhance service offerings


Change Management & Collaboration


Lead change management initiatives for the rollout of self-service automation tools and new data analytics capabilities, ensuring smooth transitions and adoption across teams
Collaborate closely with the Technology function and stakeholders in Client Service teams to align automation efforts with organizational goals and ensure tools meet business needs
Support ongoing communication and training efforts to encourage self-service adoption and guide users through any process changes


Qualifications & Skills


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
>5 years of proven experience in transforming operational and client-facing processes through data manipulation and insights
>5 years of proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions, particularly self-service tools
Strong understanding of automation platforms and scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Power Automate or similar)
Highly proficient with tools such as Power BI, Power Apps, and Google Apps Script or Web Apps. Certification in these areas would be preferable
Knowledge of data-wrangling tools e.g. Alteryx is useful but not a must-have
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to build effective solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive automation projects and improve workflows


Additional Information


We are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on any legally protected status.


Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to ‘Connect the world’. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

  • Highly proficient with tools such as Power BI, Power Apps, and Google Apps Script or Web Apps. Certification in these areas would be preferable

Title: Data Engineer (AI & Backend Support)
Description:
Aifano GmbH is an AI-driven company dedicated to revolutionizing enterprise workflows through intelligent automation and data-driven solutions. We develop products that seamlessly integrate AI technologies to optimize business processes efficiently. Our focus is on leveraging the best foundation models, fine-tuning AI for enterprise needs, and ensuring secure, scalable AI adoption.


Tasks


🚀 Data Engineer (AI & Backend Support) – Join Aifano GmbH!




Are you passionate about data engineering, backend development, and AI-powered technologies? Do you enjoy designing scalable data models, optimizing pipelines, and leveraging machine learning for intelligent automation? If so, Aifano GmbH is looking for you!




**🔥 What You'll Be Working On**
✅ Designing and implementing **data models** to support AI-driven applications
✅ Developing **scalable data pipelines** using **Supabase**, **Prisma**, and event-driven architectures
✅ Supporting backend teams in **database architecture, query optimization, and API development**
✅ Investigating and implementing **prompt engineering** techniques for AI model optimization
✅ Researching and applying **machine learning technologies** to extract and process enterprise data
✅ Ensuring data integrity, security, and performance across distributed systems
✅ Collaborating with AI engineers to integrate **foundation models** into enterprise workflows
✅ Writing clean, testable, and well-documented code for data infrastructure and services


Requirements


**💡 What We're Looking For**
🔹 Strong expertise in **data modeling, database design, and backend architecture**
🔹 Experience with **Supabase, Prisma, PostgreSQL, and event-driven architectures**
🔹 Knowledge of **ETL pipelines, data warehouses, and real-time data processing**
🔹 Familiarity with **prompt engineering** and **machine learning frameworks**
🔹 Experience integrating AI models into backend systems (e.g., OpenAI, Cohere, Anthropic)
🔹 Proficiency in **Python** and **TypeScript/Node.js** for backend support
🔹 Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for AI-driven automation




**🚀 What Makes You Stand Out**
🔸 Hands-on experience with **foundation models** and their enterprise applications
🔸 Knowledge of **MLOps, model fine-tuning, and Reinforcement Learning (RLHF)**
🔸 Experience with **message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ) and distributed computing**
🔸 Contributions to open-source projects or a strong GitHub portfolio


Benefits


💼 Location: Remote-first with options for hybrid work in Germany
📅 Start Date: ASAP




If you're ready to shape the future of AI-powered enterprise solutions, apply now and be part of Aifano's journey! 🚀

Title: Aggiunto/a scientifico/a
Company: State Secretariat for Migration SEM, Switzerland
Description:
Segreteria di Stato della migrazione SEM, 80-100%, Boudry

Il contributo che può dare


Rilevare e analizzare gli indicatori di direzione, proponendo soluzioni e misure
Produrre, aggiornare e presentare statistiche inerenti alla regione
Condurre progetti, sviluppare strumenti di pilotaggio
Elaborare rapporti e analisi, sviluppare e migliorare i processi
Collaborare strettamente con il team della regione Svizzera romanda e con i vari fornitori di servizio e su mandato con le autorità
Rappresentare la regione in vari comitati/sedute


Che cosa La contraddistingue


Titolo universitario, preferibilmente in economia, economia aziendale, Business Administration
Conoscenza approfondita della gestione dei dati e dell'analisi statistica
Eccellenti capacità analitiche, di sintesi, concettuali e redazionali, interesse per approcci multidisciplinari, padronanza degli strumenti informatici standard
Forte senso della comunicazione, esperienza nella gestione dei progetti, spirito di gruppo e iniziativa, capacità di lavorare in autonomia, efficiente e precisa
Buona conoscenza di una seconda lingua ufficiale e conoscenza attiva dell'inglese


La migrazione ci riguarda

La Segreteria di Stato della migrazione (SEM) è competente per le questioni di diritto migratorio in Svizzera. L'ambito direzionale Centri federali d'asilo della SEM tratta le domande d'asilo presentate in Svizzera. La regione d'asilo Svizzera romanda, parte integrante dell'ambito direzionale, condivide peraltro la responsabilità per quanto attiene al primo alloggio e alla registrazione dei richiedenti d'asilo nuovamente giunti in Svizzera.

Che cosa offriamo

Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversitàLa concretizzazione delle pari opportunità ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Informazioni complementari

Per il momento il posto è limitato fino al 31.12.2025, con possibilità di proroga. A Boudry la lingua di lavoro è il francese.

Si prega di candidarsi tramite il nostro sistema di gestione delle candidature. A tal fine, cliccare su «Per candidarsi».

Title: Manager Data and Analytics
Description:
Description

We are seeking an experienced Manager, Data & Analytics to lead our data and reporting initiatives, supporting our decision-making processes with advanced data analytics. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and similar technologies, and have a deep understanding of data warehousing concepts to manage vast amounts of data effectively. You will be responsible for managing business intelligence (BI) tools, data warehousing solutions to ensure that our systems provide actionable insights for business success.


Lead the development and execution of comprehensive data strategies that align with our business goals.
Oversee data projects from start to finish, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment.
Design and maintain advanced data models within data warehouse to support data visualization, reporting needs, and analytics
Ensure the maintenance, optimization, and expansion of data warehousing upholding data quality and integrity.
Collaborate with different departments to identify process improvement opportunities and implement BI solutions to address complex business issues.
Keep up with the latest trends and technologies in business intelligence, data warehousing, and analytics
Align with program/project teams to provide solution architecture, design and delivery for BI COE projects
Establishing measures and metrics for managing workload, work estimates and quality of deliverables from BI team
Drives standardization of Analytics and reporting across the organization
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the team, and actively seek out new technologies and methodologies that can improve the way the team works.


Requirements

Qualifications and Educational Requirements:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
7+ years experience as a hands on data analyst / architect
3+ years as a Data & Analytics Manager or similar role, with extensive experience in data analytics, business intelligence, and data warehouse management.
Expertise in Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and similar technologies including data warehouse principles and technologies.
Must have functional experience in SAP S/4 including CDS views
Strong knowledge of SQL, database management systems, and experience with cloud-based data warehouse environments.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the capability to convert complex data from the data warehouse into actionable business insights.
Demonstrated leadership and project management abilities, with a history of successfully managing BI projects.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively engaging with all organizational levels.


Essential/Preferred Skills


MBA or advanced degree in related area
Lean Process Improvement training and/or certification


Work Conditions And Physical Requirements


Ability to work in both office and manufacturing environments.
Availability to work outside of core business hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays when required for system upgrades or migrations.
Required to sit or stand for long periods of time.
The ability to lift 30-50 lbs without assistance.
Local and/or international travel will be required as needed (10-15%) including some extended stays on location for education or deployments. Must have a valid driver's license and Passport.

Title: Senior Data Engineer (a) 80-100%
Description:
Wir erweitern unser IT-Team. Deine täglichen Mitspieler kommen aus den Bereichen Data Analytics, Application Management, IT-Betrieb sowie aus Fachbereichen wie Marketing oder Finance und natürlich aus unseren Swiss Casinos an den Standorten Zürich, Pfäffikon SZ, St. Gallen, Schaffhausen und Winterthur sowie unserem Online Casino.




Bist du unser Ass im Ärmel und unterstützt mit deinen Skills unsere IT?




Dein Spiel

Dich fasziniert, aus Daten wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu generieren, hierzu unterschiedlichste Datenquellen zu analysieren, aufzubereiten und zu kombinieren und auch aus grossen Datenmengen die "Nadel im Heuhaufen" herauszufiltern
Dank deines herausragenden analytischen Verständnisses, behältst du bei deiner Arbeit stets Qualität, Sicherheit und Nachhaltigkeit der gewählten Lösungen im Kopf und wächst an kniffligen technischen Fragestellungen
Du stellst die langfristige nachhaltige Betreibbarkeit gemeinsam mit dem IT-Betrieb sicher, evaluierst neue Technologien, baust Lösungen in den Bereichen Data Warehousing und Data Lakes auf und aus und verbesserst diese kontinuierlich




Unsere Spielregeln

Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium auf Stufe Universität/ETH oder FH mit Schwerpunkt Informatik und bringst mindestens 8 Jahre Erfahrung als Data Engineer mit, gerne ergänzt mit weiteren Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Software Engineering oder Data & Analytics
Du kennst Azure und die zugehörigen Datenplattformen in- und auswendig, fühlst dich bei der Entwicklung wie auch beim Troubleshooting und Unterhalt von Datenplattformen und -Pipelines wohl und kennst die relevanten Sprachen und Werkzeuge, insbesondere ELT-/ETL-Prozesse, Python, SQL, Apache Spark, Synapse, Data Factory, Fabric, IaC
Du kommunizierst verhandlungssicher auf Deutsch und Englisch, packst als pragmatischer Teamplayer gerne mit an und hilfst als Teil des Data Teams, unsere Lösungen auf die nächste Stufe zu heben




Dein Spielfeld

Noch Fragen? Dann melde Dich bei Daniela: daniela.kroner@scgroup.ch

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Main Purpose:We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our Market Liquidity team. This is an exciting new opportunity to work on XVA pricing models as well as contributing to a Quant Library in a dynamic and leading commodity house.Knowledge Skills and Abilities, Key Responsibilities:

Very strong analytical and mathematical skill

Comfortable with derivatives modelling concepts

Strong Python programming skills & experience, C++ and others a plus

Attention to details

Demonstrable team skills both within and across teams

Ability to pick up new concepts and think outside the box quickly

Ability to deliver fast and efficient programming solutions

Key Responsibilities

Developing and maintaining methodologies and quantitative tools

Liaising with stakeholders across the business (Traders, MO, Risk, Credit, IT)

Assess the risk (xVA) associated to every new transaction.

Competencies

Masters or higher numerate degree in one of the following Maths/Engineering/Physics/Science/Finance

Must have 5+ years working, preferably in an XVA quantitative business in commodity, including CVA/FVA, but could be rates and currencies products as well

Candidates with experience in exotic/non-linear products might also be considered

Experience in delivering production quality code, including use of source control, continuous integration, unit and regression testing

Key Relationships and Department Overview:

Key Relationships

Traders

MO

Risk

Credit

IT

Reporting Structure

- Reporting XVA Manager, Oil, LNG & Gas trading

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse workforce! We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Data Engineer 80-100%
Description:
Data Engineer 80 - 100%

Du wählst - arbeite an unseren Standorten in Chur, The Circle/Zürich, St. Gallen, Bern oder im Home-Office, dabei stehen dir attraktive und flexible Voll- und Teilzeitmodelle offen.

"Die Technologie verändert sich ständig, und bei Inventx bin ich immer am Puls der Zeit – ein echtes Sprungbrett für meine Karriere."

Bei Inventx gestaltest du den digitalen Wandel in der Finanz- und Versicherungsindustrie mit. An der Schnittstelle zwischen IT und Banking oder Insurance sorgst du mit uns dafür, dass sich unsere Kunden rund um die Uhr auf ihre moderne Plattformen verlassen können und zu digitaler Innovation befähigt werden.

Du bist ein begeisterungsfähiger Teamplayer und Dein Herzblut steckt in der Entwicklung von zukunftsgerichteten Dienstleistungen? Du hast ein Flair für Daten und möchtest Deine Erfahrung im Data Warehouse Bereich einbringen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung. In einem dynamischen Team von Data Engineers und DWH/BI-Experten kannst Du Dich in spannenden Projekten mit einbringen.

Was ist dein Gestaltungsraum?


Du betreust die DWH-Plattform über ihren gesamten Lifecycle.
Du entwickelst ETL-Ladestrecken, übernimmst den DWH-Betrieb (inkl. Pikettdienst) und baust das Enterprise Data Warehouse weiter aus, einschließlich der Datenmodellierung.
Du passt Reports und Dashboards an und entwickelst sie weiter.
Du schätzt den Aufwand neuer Kundenanforderungen ein, setzt sie um und koordinierst sie.
Du entwirfst und entwickelst neue DWH-Services im Team und in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden.
Du berätst zu Datenarchitekturen und gestaltest diese.
Du arbeitest eng mit internen und externen Stakeholdern aus Business und IT zusammen.


Was bringst du mit?


Erfolgreiches Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Berufslehre mit entsprechender Weiterbildung (HF oder FH)
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in Design, Umsetzung und Betrieb eines Data Warehouse
Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL-Abfragen, ETL und Datenbanken, idealerweise Erfahrung mit Microsoft BI-Stack (Power BI, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS) und/oder Oracle DB sowie Python und Airflow
Bankfach-Kenntnisse und Erfahrung mit Kernbankensystemen von Vorteil
Erfahrung in Datenmodellierung und Datenarchitekturen von Vorteil
Eigenverantwortung, Teamfähigkeit, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein und ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie Englischkenntnisse


Wieso Inventx?

Unsere Unternehmenskultur baut auf unseren Werten Innovation, Interaktion und Swissness sowie einem einzigartigen Teamspirit mit tollen Benefits:


Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle inkl. Kompensation von Überstunden und Home-Office
Learning Points & Unterstützung bei Aus- und Weiterbildungen
Bis zu 33 Tage Ferien
Zahlreiche Mitarbeitenden- und Teamevents
EventX Mitarbeitendenverein & ix.Innovation Lab


Lass dir das von unseren beiden Unternehmensgründern bestätigen und besuch unseren Unternehmens-Blog.

Interessiert?

Dann gib’ Deiner Karriere einen Schub!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung

Manuel Stadler

manuel.stadler@inventx.ch

Bewerbungen über Stellenvermittler werden nicht berücksichtigt.
Show more

Title: Programme Trainee Data Analytics
Description:
Durant ton stage, tu feras partie de l’équipe Pilotage & Développement dans le département des Prestations qui est en charge du paiement des prestations à nos clients de la prévoyance (assurance vie individuelle et collective). Ta mission commence le 1er octobre 2025 et dure 12 mois.

Ce que tu peux réaliser chez nous

Tes tâches consisteront de produire et générer des analyses statistiques sur les données des prestations vie (périodiques ou non), mais aussi à la compréhension et visualisation de celles-ci. Pour cela tu utiliseras divers outils (comme power BI par exemple) et langages de programmation (R).

Tu auras l'occasion de contribuer à l'augmentation de l'efficience du service de gestion des prestations et à la compréhension de la sinistralité grâce aux analyses et modèles statistiques réalisés. Tu seras également impliqué-e dans d'autres projets visant divers objectifs, où tes initiatives seront reconnues et valorisées.

La collaboration est un mot qui te parle: dans cette mission, tu collabores avec différents départements (actuariat, controlling, prestations, soutien à la vente) afin de réunir les expertises permettant d’accomplir tes tâches avec succès.

Ce que tu apportes


Diplôme universitaire (Master) avec une orientation actuariat, business analytics, data analytics, sciences informatiques avec connaissances en méthodes statistiques
Connaissances en programmation « R » et/ou d’autres langages informatiques requises, ainsi que Power BI souhaitées
Forte capacité d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes
Esprit d'équipe, proactivité et autonomie
Intérêt pour la branche de l'assurance, en particulier l’assurance vie
Langue maternelle française, une bonne maîtrise de l'allemand est un plus


Travailler chez nous

Des tâches variées et passionnantes t'attendent au sein d'une équipe motivée.

Ton taux d'occupation est négociable à partir de 80%. Le salaire annuel s’élève à CHF 79’300.-, 13ème salaire inclus. De plus, nous t’offrons une participation mensuelle de CHF 120 à ta prime d’assurance maladie sur la base d’un taux d’activité à plein temps de 100%.

Chez nous, tu peux compter sur des modèles de temps de travail flexibles et le télétravail. En plus de tes 25 jours de vacances minimum, nous t’offrons également un abonnement demi-tarif ainsi que d’autres avantages attrayants. Profite en outre d’une vaste offre de formations internes et de réductions sur les événements les plus divers.

Découvre d'autres informations intéressantes sur notre programme Trainee.

Intéressé-e?

Alors envoie-nous ta candidature en toute simplicité. Nous nous réjouissons de te rencontrer !

Si tu as des questions, n’hésite pas à contacter Marie D’Onofrio (Recruiting) ou Clianna Testuz (Responsable du Pilotage & Développement).

Notre Processus De Recrutement


Au plus tard trois semaines après l’envoi de ta candidature, tu sauras si tu es invité-e à l'événement de candidature.
Le mercredi 30 avril 2025, entre 13h00 et 17h00 environ, aura lieu notre événement de candidature. Comme la participation est obligatoire, nous te prions de réserver cette date.


Nous recrutons ce poste sans aide d'agences de placement.

Votre contact

Marie D'Onofrio

Talent Attraction

+41 31 389 62 56

marie.donofrio@mobi.ch



Notre culture de travail

Nous créons de la valeur ajoutée pour nos clients grâce à notre compétence. En raison de nos collaborateurs dévoués et compétents, nous sommes performants et la compagnie d'assurance la plus personnelle de Suisse



Notre processus de recrutement

Que se passe-t-il lorsque j'ai déposé mon dossier de candidature? Voici notre processus de recrutement et le temps nécessaire pour les différentes étapes.

die Mobiliar



Nos conditions d’engagement

L’engagement de nos collaboratrices et de nos collaborateurs est la clé de notre succès. Nous investissons dans des rémunérations conformes au marché ainsi que dans des conditions de travail attrayantes et un environnement de travail inspirant.



Travailler sur les sites de Direction

La Mobilière a établi ses quartiers principaux à Berne il y a presque 200 ans. Depuis 2005, nous avons également un siège principal à Nyon, en Suisse romande, et depuis 2015, un autre à Zurich.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ref: 533ASISW

Title: Data Scientist - Commodities Trading

Location: Thalwil, Zurich, Switzerland

Salary: Attractive

Date: 11th March 2025




Our client, a leading global financial institution, is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join their team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong background in quantitative methodologies, eager to develop and enhance analytics solutions that drive commodity management decisions. You will collaborate with digital teams and business stakeholders to identify priorities and optimize workflows, leveraging advanced data science techniques.




Duties Include:




Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities where machine learning can enhance decision-making.
Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning models, including regression, classification, text analysis, and time series forecasting.
Collect, process, analyze, and visualize large structured and unstructured datasets from internal and external sources.
Apply appropriate modeling techniques to generate actionable insights and improve analytics solutions.
Monitor and enhance model performance, expanding scope as needed.
Partner with data engineers to build scalable, repeatable data pipelines, ensuring consistency and robustness in analytics applications.
Establish best practices for integration projects and data-driven initiatives.




The preferred candidate should possess experience in Python code and strong knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., Git, Agile methodology) with additional knowledge in MLOps, model architecture design, and testing patterns) excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to interact at all levels of business efficiently.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please email your C.V. to contact@altussearch.ch or call Altus Search on +41 (0) 41 560 02 21 for a confidential discussion.

Ref: 533ASISW

Our client, a leading global financial institution, is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join their team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong background in quantitative methodologies, eager to develop and enhance analytics solutions that drive commodity management decisions. You will collaborate with digital teams and business stakeholders to identify priorities and optimize workflows, leveraging advanced data science techniques.


Duties Include:


  • Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities where machine learning can enhance decision-making.
  • Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning models, including regression, classification, text analysis, and time series forecasting.
  • Collect, process, analyze, and visualize large structured and unstructured datasets from internal and external sources.
  • Apply appropriate modeling techniques to generate actionable insights and improve analytics solutions.
  • Monitor and enhance model performance, expanding scope as needed.
  • Partner with data engineers to build scalable, repeatable data pipelines, ensuring consistency and robustness in analytics applications.
  • Establish best practices for integration projects and data-driven initiatives.


The preferred candidate should possess experience in Python code and strong knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., Git, Agile methodology) with additional knowledge in MLOps, model architecture design, and testing patterns) excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to interact at all levels of business efficiently.


If you are interested in this opportunity, please email your C.V. to contact@altussearch.ch or call Altus Search on +41 (0) 41 560 02 21 for a confidential discussion.

Title: Developpeur Data / BI
Description:
Nous recherchons un Business Intelligence (résidant) :




Objectif :

Participer au développement et à l’intégration de solutions de Data Intelligence.

Responsabilités :

Conception, développement, test et déploiement des applications, du domaine sous responsabilité (environnements analytiques, tableaux de bord, rapports opérationnels, interfaces de données etc.)
Prise en charge des demandes d’évolutions des applications du domaine sous responsabilité
Prise en charge des incidents des applications du domaine sous responsabilité




Profil :

Nous recherchons une personne qui à travaillé sur un environnement Oracle et qui code avec SQL
Le candidat développera des flux de données, des moteurs et de datamarts sur Oracle, sur un ELT.
2 à 3 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire.

HTML:
Nous recherchons un Business Intelligence (résidant) :


Objectif :

Participer au développement et à l’intégration de solutions de Data Intelligence.

Responsabilités :

  • Conception, développement, test et déploiement des applications, du domaine sous responsabilité (environnements analytiques, tableaux de bord, rapports opérationnels, interfaces de données etc.)
  • Prise en charge des demandes d’évolutions des applications du domaine sous responsabilité
  • Prise en charge des incidents des applications du domaine sous responsabilité

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
If any applicant doesn’t have the below skills mentioned in his CV, consider them as Reject.




Skill set:

Cloud- AWS --->Must include exp. In CV.
Python ---->Must include exp. In CV.
SQL ----->Must include exp. In CV.
Informatica ---->Must include exp. In CV.
CI/CD Pipelines---->Must include exp. In CV.
Data modelling ---->Must include exp. In CV.
Terraform----->Good to have




Note: We are looking for only EU/Swiss Nationals. French atleast C1 Level is mandatory.




Role: Senior Data Engineer

Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Years of Experience: Min. 6+ Years

Type of Hiring: Permanent

Language: French- Atleast C1 Level is mandatory and English Advanced.

Onsite/Offsite: Hybrid Remote. 3 days a week in office. 2 days remote.




Job Description:

Experience required

A university degree in Computer Science, or a related field, or a qualification deemed equivalent.
Proven experience in data engineering.
Excellent knowledge of SQL.
Past experience with Informatica PowerCenter for maintaining on-premises data pipelines.
Good experience with cloud services, particularly AWS, and familiarity with Terraform.
Experience in Python development, specifically with libraries for data handling such as Pandas and dbt.
Experience with cloud data warehouses and/or data virtualization would be highly advantageous.
Experience with Microsoft Fabric and Power BI would be highly advantageous.
Familiarity with modern software development processes, including Jira, Git, and CI/CD tools.
A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong knowledge of data modelling for analytics (star schema) as well as functional modeling for distributing data through REST API.
Basic understanding of financial products.
Fluency in both spoken and written French (good to have) and English.
Must be a resident of Switzerland.

Responsibilities

Your role

Understanding and supporting our existing data pipelines, as well as developing new ones.
Contributing to the modernization of our data platform.
Onboarding a variety of internal and external data sources.
Ensuring data quality through validation and verification processes.
Provisioning data infrastructure for data ingestion, storage, and processing.
Managing the releases of new features while guaranteeing the production stability.
Automating, orchestrating, monitoring data pipelines, and reacting to alerts.
Preparing models to distribute data to stakeholders.

Training

EPFL or equivalent.

Title: Application Consultant BI / Analytics 80-100% (m/w/d)
Description:
1968 als Handelsunternehmen für skandinavische Laborausrüstungen gegründet, ist SKAN mittlerweile Weltmarktführer im Fachbereich Isolatorenbau für aseptische Anwendungen. Eine unserer Kernkompetenzen liegt in der Fabrikation von Prozessisolatoren für die pharmazeutisch-aseptische Herstellung. Selbst komplexeste Kundenanforderungen können erfüllt werden, dank der Experten, die in unseren hauseigenen Laboren an innovativen Lösungen rund um die Isolatortechnologie forschen.

Auf einen Blick

Als Consultant im BI-Umfeld sind Sie im Team von Michael Palmer Ansprechpartner rund um Projekte und 2nd/3rd Level Support zur Weiterentwicklung und dem Einsatz unserer BI Lösung. Als Teil unseres Consulting Team sind Sie verantwortlich für das fachliche und technische Einsatzfeld der Software und begleiten die Weiterentwicklung der Lösungen im Kontext von SAP S/4HANA und der DWH/BI Umgebung mit Microsoft Power BI und SQL Server Integration Services. Das vielfältige und kompetente Team freut sich schon jetzt auf Ihre Unterstützung.

Aufgaben


Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung Systeme mit Microsoft Power BI, SQL Server und Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Betreuung und Administration des SAP Theobald Connectors
Integration dieser Systeme mit SAP S/4HANA ERP & weiteren Applikationen
Analyse komplexer Zusammenhänge und Fähigkeit diese in Worten wiederzugeben (Business Requirements Engineering)
(Teil-)Projektleitung in Innovationsprojekten, Rollouts und Einführung weiterer Systeme
Übernahme von Supportaktivitäten und Change-Management
Durchführen von Grund- und Aufbauschulungen für unsere Mitarbeitenden
Steuerung externer Partner in Support- und Projektarbeit


Hardskills


Uni-/Hochschulabschluss im Bereich Informatik/Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Application Engineering
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Power BI, SQL Server Management Studio, Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Theobald Connector, SAP S/4HANA
SAP-Kenntnisse (SAP Standard Connectoren) von Vorteil
Kenntnisse/Erfahrung im Finanzbereich (Controlling, Accounting, Sales) von Vorteil
Deutsch und Englisch verhandlungssicher


Softskills


Guter Teamplayer, Kompetenz zur bereichsübergreifenden Zusammenarbeit
Selbstständiger, eigenverantwortlicher, lösungsorientierter und strukturierter Arbeitsstil
"Hands-On-Mentalität"
Souveränes und sicheres Auftreten
Durchsetzungs- und Konfliktfähigkeit bei gleichzeitiger Kompromissbereitschaft
Hohe Belastbarkeit, Stressresistenz und Flexibilität


Wir bieten


Eine offene und kollegiale Unternehmenskultur
Freiraum für Ideen
Teilnahme an Sport und Freizeitangeboten
Intensive und joborientierte Einarbeitung
Kurze Entscheidungswege und flache Hierarchien
Offene Kommunikationspolitik
5 Wochen Ferien


Bei Fragen wenden Sie sich bitte an Steffan Fluri.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (all genders) Schadenversicherung Unternehmenskunden | 80-100%
Description:
Dein Job in Kürze


Du bereitest grosse Datenmengen auf, analysierst und demokratisierst sie – dies anhand von bestehenden Daten und auf der Suche nach neuen sinnvollen Datenquellen.
Von dir bereitgestellte Daten gehen u.a. in Planung, jährlichen Sanierungen, Compliance-Prozessen, Controllings, Portfolio-Eingriffen und Vertriebsmassnahmen auf.
Unterstütze uns mit deiner «Daten-Brille», lass uns wo nötig auf neuen Wegen präziser und effizienter agieren!



Was dich erwartet

Baloise krempelt sich gerade um: Digitalisierung trifft auf Business Transformation, Kulturwandel auf Strategic Skilling. Es ist ein Prozess, der uns vielfältig fordert und in dieser Phase des Wandels / Lernens, übernimmst du einen Job, der uns hilft, bessere Entscheide zu treffen.

Zu deinen Aufgaben gehört:


Du kennst das Portfolio, kannst hier vertieft Auskunft geben und betreust wichtige Planungsprozesse.
Du verantwortest die analytische Weiterentwicklung der Schadenversicherung für Unternehmenskunden.
Du bist anfangs besonders gefordert, aufzuräumen und tatkräftig mitzuhelfen, unsere alte Welt in eine neue zu überführen
Du bringst unsere Digitalisierung voran und optimierst Prozesse der Entscheidungsfindung mittels Automatisierung und verbessertem Datenmanagement.
Du findest Use Cases für neue Verfahren und verbindest fachliche Anforderungen mit analytischen Methoden.
Du bist fachliche und technische Schnittstelle und mit deinem Spezialwissen auch beratend unterwegs.



Unser Ziel: tiefere Erkenntnisse gewinnen, präzisere Vorhersagen treffen und effizientere / effektivere Massnahmen definieren.

Dein Team

Das Schadenversicherung Unternehmenskunden ist ein Team von ca. 55 Personen, das sich darum kümmert, für Unternehmen aller Grössen passende Lösungen anzubieten, um ihre Risiken abzusichern. Um erfolgreich zu sein, arbeiten wir eng mit vielen Bereichen zusammen, wie z.B. Schadenmanagement, Broker- und Aussendienstvertrieb, Pricing, Aktuariat und Risikomanagement.

Deine Rolle dabei? Du agierst mit deiner Expertise überwiegend eigenständig, unterstützt das Team jedoch gezielt mit deinem Fachwissen und deiner Erfahrung.

Was wir erwarten

Lass uns verstehen, was du analysierst! Wichtig ist, dass du Daten in Beziehung zu unserem versicherungstechnischen Geschäft siehst und ins Business übersetzen kannst.

Du bringst im besten Fall bereits Erfahrung im Versicherungsgeschäft für Unternehmenskunden sowie die Neugierde und Fähigkeit mit, dir eigenständig oder mithilfe der Baloise-Community von Experten und Expertinnen weitere Analysefelder erschliessen zu können.

Sei wertschätzend, konstruktiv und umgänglich: Du hast viele verschiedene Menschen um dich, die du unterschiedlich adressieren solltest.

Deine Qualifikationen:


abgeschlossenes Studium mit datenanalytischem Schwerpunkt und fundiertem Methodikwissen
mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung in der Anwendung von Analyseverfahren
Analyse-/Programmierkenntnisse sowie fundiertes Wissen im Umgang mit und der Manipulation von Datenbanken (z.B. Excel, R, Python, Access und SQL)
Anwenden von Business Intelligence-Tools (z.B. SAS VA, SAS EG)
Erfahrung mit Projektleitungs- und Planungsprozessen
Gutes Deutsch, Französisch wünschenswert



Falls du schon eingestiegen bist, gerne auch mit Advanced Analytics (wie data/text mining, machine learning, visualization, semantic analysis, simulations, predictive modelling etc.). Falls noch nicht, dann gerne durch deine Bereitschaft hier Knowhow aufzubauen, um dich bzw. uns weiterzuentwickeln.

Noch Fragen? Wir beantworten sie gerne.

Alexandra Kromer

Recruiting Partner

Alexandra.Kromer@baloise.com

Verena Beeck

Leiterin Schadenversicherung Unternehmenskunden

verena.beeck@baloise.ch
Show more

  • Gutes Deutsch, Französisch wünschenswert


Falls du schon eingestiegen bist, gerne auch mit Advanced Analytics (wie data/text mining, machine learning, visualization, semantic analysis, simulations, predictive modelling etc.). Title: SAP BI and Analytics
Description:
ONE Agency | IT Recruitment Experts

SAP BI and AnalyticsAbout our client

For our client, who is continuously developing and therefore creates a unique added value, we are looking for:

Your responsibilities


Consulting business stakeholders on all levels about BI/Analytics applications and interfaces to other applications
Overseeing the plan, build and run processes of BI/Analytics applications based on Qlikview and Qliksense
Effort estimation and managing the related budgets
Management of nearshore/offshore developers and third party providers where applicable
Develop and adhere to governance processes around implementation and the use of Qlikview / QlikSense
Planning and delivering trainings on Qlikview and Qliksense for end users, especially in the context of Self-Service Analytics
Pro-actively identifying changes needed in the application lifecycle and make recommendations for improvements with the subsequent implementation
Support proper operations and data currency of existing application landscape, design and update required support frameworks


Your profile


Bachelor or Master's degree in technical or business studies or equivalent experience
2+ years of working experience as a BI / Analytics Consultant or similar position in-house in an international corporation
2+ years (hands-on) experience in defining and/or managing large scale Qlikview/-Sense enterprise deployments
Familiarity with ?Governed Self Service BI? concepts being able to advice on best practices and storytelling visualizations
Experience in SQL with the ability of creating views and ad-hoc queries incorporating business logic
Exposure to top management to meet expectations and escalate issues/risks
Able to manage project requirements, design, development, code/test case reviews, testing and deployment phases
First experience with advanced analytics concepts on ?big data? would be a plus (e.g. Machine Learning)
Experience extracting information from core SAP Financials and/or SAP Logistics modules as well as SAP BI/BW is a big plus
Project management (PMP, Scrum) and IT Service Management (ITIL) experience is a strong asset
Production/manufacturing background would be a strong additional asset
Fluent in English is a must. German would be a plus


Your chance

Take your chance and apply now for this interesting challenge at jobs@oneagency.ch .

Settore: Altro

Ruolo: Altro

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Logmind is a dynamic and innovative startup based in Lausanne, Switzerland, specializing in cloud-based AIOps solution. Our platform automatically detects issues within an organization's application and infrastructure logs and alert data, enabling IT teams in large enterprises to proactively identify and resolve technical problems in complex IT environments.




We are looking for an entrepreneurial and collaborative team member with hands-on experience in machine learning, predictive analytics, and software engineering.




Your qualifications & competencies:

MSc or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related fields.
Expertise in modern programming languages and analytics tools such as Python, Scala, Kafka, Spark, Elasticsearch, etc.
Expertise in data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, anomaly detection, sequential pattern discovery, and text mining.
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and transformer-based architectures (e.g., GPT, BERT, or similar models).
Motivated and passionate about large-scale machine learning problems, with the ability to think big and execute effectively.
Good communication skills - ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audience.
Relevant IT industry experience would be a plus.




Your responsibilities:

Design, prototype, and develop advanced algorithms for processing time-series text and metric data.
Implement, test, and optimize proposed algorithms for large-scale environments, ensuring efficiency and scalability with real-time data streams.
Closely collaborate with the software engineering team to integrate proposed methods into the core platform.
Analyze large datasets to uncover insights, improve detection accuracy and refine model performance.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, deep learning, and observability to drive continuous innovation.




Advantages of working with us:

Unique career development and growth opportunities
Work with a friendly, motivated and talented team
Opportunity to have a real impact and to make a difference for both customers and the internal team
Work in a fast-growing and innovative start-up environment from the office at EPFL Innovation Park.




We offer full-time positions based in Lausanne, Switzerland. Thus, you have to be eligible to work and live in Switzerland.

Show more

  • Closely collaborate with the software engineering team to integrate proposed methods into the core platform.
  • Analyze large datasets to uncover insights, improve detection accuracy and refine model performance.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, deep learning, and observability to drive continuous innovation.


Advantages of working with us:

  • Unique career development and growth opportunities
  • Work with a friendly, motivated and talented team
  • Opportunity to have a real impact and to make a difference for both customers and the internal team
  • Work in a fast-growing and innovative start-up environment from the office at EPFL Innovation Park.


We offer full-time positions based in Lausanne, Switzerland. Thus, you have to be eligible to work and live in Switzerland.

Title: Energy Data Management - Business Analyst
Description:
🧩 Darwin Partners, un véritable partenaire de carrière 🧩




Chez Darwin Partners, nous ne nous contentons pas de recruter : nous accompagnons chaque consultant dans son évolution professionnelle en lui proposant des missions qui correspondent à ses aspirations.

Avec une culture dynamique et axée sur l’impact, nous connectons les meilleurs talents IT à des projets ambitieux, tout en cultivant des relations humaines et authentiques.

👥 Nos clients ? Des entreprises innovantes dans différents secteurs d’activité (banque, assurance, finance, industrie, e-commerce, marchés publics, trading, médical ...) et des projets à forte valeur ajoutée sur différents métiers (étude & développement, fonctionnel, agilité, infrastructure, réseaux, data, cloud ...)

🤝 Notre engagement ? Un suivi régulier, une écoute active et une véritable proximité avec nos talents.

✨ Notre promesse ? Des projets enrichissants et une rémunération à la hauteur de votre talent.







Nous recherchons un Senior Business Analyst ayant une solide expérience dans le secteur de l’énergie, idéalement avec une expertise en gestion de données et/ou finance. L'objectif est de rejoindre l'équipe spécialisée energy data management qui joue un rôle clé dans la gestion des outils d'onboarding/CRM, du portail client et des systèmes de gestion des données énergétiques en Europe, aux États-Unis et sur d'autres marchés en expansion.




🔒Vos missions 🔒

Être en contact direct avec les équipes business pour comprendre leurs besoins et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Organiser le travail des développeurs et gérer la roadmap en coordination avec le Team Lead EDM IT.
Maintenir et suivre les backlogs.
Rédiger et exécuter les tests.
Assurer un reporting




🧠 Le profil que nous recherchons 🧠




Excellente capacité à expliquer des problématiques complexes et à faire passer des messages clairs.
Capacité à travailler en autonomie tout en étant orienté client et esprit d’équipe.
Excellentes compétences en communication.
Anglais courant obligatoire
Expérience confirmée dans le secteur de l’énergie et/ou de la finance.










💡 Ce qui fait notre différence au sein de Darwin Partners 💡

Une entreprise à taille humaine et smart, avec une approche personnalisée et bienveillante. Aujourd’hui, nous sommes près de 110 collaborateurs à nous engager au quotidien pour satisfaire nos clients !

Des projets stratégiques et stimulants, où vous pourrez vraiment avoir un impact.

Un accompagnement sur-mesure, avec un suivi régulier et des perspectives d’évolution.




📌 Notre processus de recrutement 📌

Nous savons que votre temps est précieux, alors chez Darwin Partners, nous faisons simple et efficace !

1️⃣ Premier échange RH – Un moment pour parler de vous, de vos ambitions et de nos opportunités.

2️⃣ Entretien technique et métier – Discussion avec un manager pour valider votre expertise et votre vision de l’agilité.

2️⃣ (Bis) Test technique ou échange avec un consultant expert – Selon le poste, une évaluation technique ou un échange approfondi avec un consultant de notre réseau pour affiner l’adéquation avec la mission et vous donner envie de nous rejoindre.

3️⃣ Entretien client – Rencontre avec l’entreprise partenaire pour un dernier échange avant le GO final.




📩 Prêt(e) à nous rejoindre ?

N’hésitez pas à postuler directement via cette annonce en cliquant sur l’onglet “Candidature Simplifiée”.

Title: Trainee Programm als Data Analyst im Risk- und Immobilien-Management (w/m/d)
Description:
Liegt deine Leidenschaft im Programmieren und der Datenvisualisierung? Dann bist du bei uns richtig! In deiner Rolle unterstützt du unser Immobilien- und Riskmanagement durch spannende Datenanalysen. Dein Einsatz startet am 1. Oktober 2025 und ist befristet für ein Jahr.

Das bewirkst du bei uns

Der Kern deines Jobs betrifft Extraktion, Transformation und Laden von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, in dem du die entsprechende Programmierung übernimmst.

Du unterstützt die Fachexpert:innen bei der Optimierung von Datenverarbeitungs- und Analyseprozessen sowie bei der Interpretation der Ergebnisse. Die innovative Visualisierung und Aufbereitung sowie die Präsentation der Ergebnisse ergänzen deine Zuständigkeiten. Dadurch hilfst du datengetriebene Entscheidungen rund um das quantitative Risk- und Immobilienmanagement zu fördern.

Im Rahmen deiner Tätigkeiten fokussierst du dich unter anderem auf die Auswertung einzelner Anlageklassen wie z.B. der Immobilien oder Aktien. Dabei analysierst du Kennzahlen wie Performance, ESG-Ratings oder CO2 Informationen.

Das bringen Sie mit


Abgeschlossenes Masterstudium (Data Science / Informatik / Wirtschaftsinformatik / Mathematik) oder Masterarbeit im Bereich Asset / Risk Management von Vorteil
Interesse an Data Analytics / Data Science und Programmierung (Python)
Kenntnisse der Finanzwelt, Asset Management und Risk Management von Vorteil
Engagierte, selbständige sowie verantwortungsbewusste Persönlichkeit
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse, solide Englischkenntnisse sind ein Plus


Bei uns arbeiten

Auf dich warten motivierte Kolleg:innen und vielfältige Aufgaben in den beiden Bereichen Risk- & Performance Management sowie Immobilien.

Dein Arbeitspensum ist ab 80% verhandelbar. Die Vergütung für das Trainee-Programm beträgt bei einem Arbeitspensum von 100% CHF 79'300 pro Jahr, einschliesslich des 13. Monatslohns. Zusätzlich beteiligen wir uns an deinen Gesundheitskosten und zahlen dir einen Krankenkassenbeitrag von CHF 120 pro Monat aus.

Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice sind bei uns selbstverständlich. Du hast mindestens 25 Ferientage und erhältst von uns ein Halbtax sowie weitere attraktive Fringe Benefits. Profitiere zudem von einem grossen internen Ausbildungsangebot und Vergünstigungen an vielfältigen Events.

Entdecke weitere spannende Informationen zu unserem Trainee-Programm, wie beispielsweise dem optionalen Auslandeinsatz.

Neugierig?

Bewirb dich rasch und unkompliziert. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Bei Fragen melde dich ungeniert bei Marc Brunner (Financial Risk Manager, 031 389 65 45) oder mir.

Unser Bewerbungsprozess


Spätestens nach drei Wochen erfährst du, ob du beim Bewerbungsevent dabei bist. Wir lassen es offen, ob wir dich vorher noch zu einem online Kennenlernen einladen.
Am Dienstag, 22. April 2025, findet unser Bewerbungsevent statt. Da eine Teilnahme erforderlich ist, bitten wir dich, das Datum zu reservieren.


Wir besetzen diese Stelle ohne Unterstützung von externen Personaldienstleistern.

Ihr Kontakt

Matthias Scheurer

Talent Attraction

0041 31 389 62 38

matthias.scheurer@mobi.ch



Unsere Arbeitskultur

Mit hoher Kompetenz schaffen wir Mehrwert für unsere Kunden. Dank unseren engagierten und kompetenten Mitarbeitenden sind wir erfolgreich und die persönlichste Versicherung der Schweiz.



Unser Bewerbungsprozess

Was passiert wenn ich meine Bewerbung eingereicht habe? Das sind unsere Prozessschritte und der dafür notwendige Zeitaufwand.

die Mobiliar



Unsere Anstellungsbedingungen

Unsere engagierten Mitarbeitenden sind der Schlüssel zu unserem Erfolg. Deshalb investieren wir in eine marktgerechte Vergütung, attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen und ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld.



Arbeiten auf der Direktion

Seit fast 200 Jahren hat die Mobiliar ihren Hauptsitz in Bern. Seit 2005 sind wir mit je einem Hauptsitz auch in Nyon in der Westschweiz und seit 2015 in Zürich vertreten.


Show more

Title: Praktikant Power BI (m/w/d)
Description:
WOFÜR WIR SIE SUCHEN

Als Praktikant (m/w/d) an unserem Standort in Zürich unterstützen Sie die Tätigkeiten rundum das Thema Power BI.



Erstellung von Scripts für die Schnittstellenanbindungen
Erstellung von Power BI-Berichten und Dashboards
Datenbankmodellierung
Dokumentation der Tätigkeiten
Dokumentation und Pflege von Subsystemen (SharePoint und Confluence)



WAS SIE MITBRINGEN SOLLTEN



Vorkenntnisse in den Programmen MS Office, MS Power BI und SAP
Erfahrung mit der Programmiersprache DAX sowie PowerQuery
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Fähigkeit zum Teamwork, schnelle Auffassungsgabe und Flexibilität



WAS WIR IHNEN BIETEN



Ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit spannenden Projekten
Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleit- und Vertrauensarbeitszeit); Home-Office, wo möglich und sinnvoll
Sehr gute Sozialleistungen und eine überobligatorische Pensionskasse
Mitarbeitervorteile eines Grosskonzerns, Mitarbeiteraktienkaufprogramm
Förderung von bedarfsgerechter Weiterbildung
Personalrestaurant sowie externe Verpflegungs- und Einkaufsmöglichkeiten in der Nähe
Individuelle interne sowie externe Personalentwicklungsmassnahmen in
Zusammenarbeit mit unserer Rheinmetall-Academy
Arbeitsplatz wenige Gehminuten vom Bahnhof Zürich-Oerlikon entfernt

Für Fragen zu Ihrer Bewerbung, nutzen Sie bitte das Kontaktformular.

Wir weisen darauf hin, dass Dossiers von Personalvermittlern nicht berücksichtigt werden.

Title: Data Engineer – Cloud & IoT
Description:
The Role

We’re looking for a Data Engineer – Cloud & IoT who thrives on real-time data challenges, enjoys working with complex and heterogeneous data, and wants to play a key role in building a best-in-class data architecture.




This role is a mix of data engineering and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). You will be responsible for ingesting, processing, and analyzing diverse data streams from thousands of IoT devices, including video, audio, metadata, and events.




The challenge? Ensuring seamless real-time data flow, handling a wide variety of structured and unstructured data, and enabling live dashboards and automated insights.




Responsibilities

Data Engineer:

Architect and develop scalable, real-time data pipelines to process IoT data streams (video, audio, metadata, events)
Handle heterogeneous data formats and sources, ensuring consistent processing and integration
Optimize data ingestion and transformation for real-time analytics and live dashboards
Work with stakeholders to design data-driven automation and AI-powered decision-making
Develop efficient ETL/ELT pipelines for both real-time and batch processing
Ensure data security, governance, and compliance




SRE:

Manage and optimize AWS cloud infrastructure to support real-time data workloads
Implement monitoring, logging, and alerting to track system performance and data flow
Automate infrastructure tasks and CI/CD workflows
Participate in on-call duty to ensure platform reliability




What We’re Looking For

Expertise in real-time data streaming technologies
Extensive experience in data warehousing, ideally with Snowflake, including optimization and performance tuning
Deep knowledge of SQL and data modeling for high-performance analytics
Experience designing data pipelines that integrate multiple heterogeneous sources
Hands-on experience processing structured and unstructured data
Familiarity with AWS cloud infrastructure and best practices
Understanding of monitoring, logging, and cloud automation tools
Problem-solver who enjoys working in a fast-moving, innovative environment




Why Join Us?

Hybrid Work: Work from home several days per week
Impact: Build a real-time data platform that powers AI-driven surveillance and business intelligence
Tech Challenges: Solve cutting-edge problems in IoT data streaming and cloud scalability
Team Culture: Transparency, respect, and a shared passion for innovation







About Us

With a revolutionary VSaaS (Video Surveillance as a Service) solution that sets a new standard for video protection, Morphean is on a mission to bring innovative video surveillance, access control, and business intelligence solutions to the market. Our hosted service platforms, incident detection, and video content analysis technology empower businesses with cutting-edge security and actionable insights.




With 15+ years of experience as a pioneer in digital video protection systems, we leverage AI-driven analytics, cloud scalability, and smart automation to provide next-gen surveillance. From IP camera capture to cloud recording, smart analysis, real-time alerts, and custom business intelligence tools, our platform ensures security is not just effective, but also intelligent and user-friendly.




Learn more at morphean.com.




Ready to take on the challenge? Apply now!

Title: Business Data Analyst – Sales & Marketing Insights
Description:
Job Description

Our client in the Apparel Manufacturing Industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst with a strong background in Sales and Marketing analytics to support data-driven decision-making across commercial teams. This is not a very senior role, and they are looking for candidates with 3 to 5 years of relevant work experience. The role requires a candidate with a proven track record of translating data into actionable business insights, particularly within sales operations.

Key Responsibilities


Sales & Marketing Support: Work closely with Sales and Marketing teams to analyse trends, optimise strategies, and drive revenue growth.
Actionable Insights: Develop reports and dashboards that provide clear, strategic recommendations to enhance sales performance.
Business Ownership: Take initiative in projects, demonstrating a deep understanding of business needs and proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Executive-Level Engagement: Present findings and insights to senior stakeholders, ensuring data-driven recommendations align with company objectives.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Leverage analytics tools to extract, manipulate, and visualise data, supporting sales and marketing initiatives.


Key Requirements:


Experience Level: 3 to 5 years of relevant work experience, with the ability to take ownership of projects and drive impact.
Sales & Marketing Analytics Expertise: Experience working with sales teams, marketing data, and sales operations processes.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, or Tableau.
Business Acumen: Strong ability to understand business challenges and translate data into meaningful recommendations.
Stakeholder Management: Experience working with senior executives and cross-functional teams.


Nice to Have:


Background in sales operations or revenue analytics.
Experience in CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce)


Let me know if this is good to go or if you'd like any further changes!
Show more

  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Leverage analytics tools to extract, manipulate, and visualise data, supporting sales and marketing initiatives.

  • Experience Level: 3 to 5 years of relevant work experience, with the ability to take ownership of projects and drive impact.
  • Sales & Marketing Analytics Expertise: Experience working with sales teams, marketing data, and sales operations processes.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, or Tableau.
  • Business Acumen: Strong ability to understand business challenges and translate data into meaningful recommendations.
  • Stakeholder Management: Experience working with senior executives and cross-functional teams.

Nice to Have:

  • Background in sales operations or revenue analytics.
  • Experience in CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce)

Let me know if this is good to go or if you'd like any further changes!

Title: AI Researcher (100% Remote)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more

Title: MIS Reporting Engineer 80-100%
Description:
Are you passionate about data, reporting, and automation? Do you have a keen interest in financial services, payments, and cards? At YAPEAL, we’re looking for an MIS Reporting Engineer to help us build and optimize our reporting platform, enabling teams across the company to work smarter with data.

If you have a curious mindset, love structuring data for insights, and enjoy teaching others how to work with reports and dashboards, this role is for you.

Curious to learn more? Explore the role and join us in redefining the future of finance!

About The Role

As our MIS Reporting Engineer, you’ll be responsible for designing and maintaining our MIS database, structuring operational data for insights, and helping business teams become self-sufficient in reporting. While you’ll build some reports and dashboards yourself, your real impact will come from empowering others—guiding operations, sales, and compliance teams to create their own reports using Google Looker.

A strong interest in financial services, payments, and card transactions is essential, as our MIS reporting plays a key role in providing insights into our business operations. Whether it’s understanding transaction flows, regulatory reporting, or business performance metrics, your ability to connect data to our business context will be crucial.

Our current stack includes Golang, Postgres, and Google Looker. If you already have experience with these, that’s a big plus — but not a must — you will learn fast. More important is your ability to structure data, model it efficiently, and support teams in making data-driven decisions.

Additionally, we’re looking for someone open to exploring AI-driven solutions to improve efficiency. While this is not yet a fully defined project, we expect curiosity and initiative to help shape future innovations. If there’s additional capacity, you may also support development beyond MIS-related tasks.

Expect a Day Full Of


Designing and optimizing our MIS database, ensuring data is structured for efficient reporting
Building pipelines to source, process, and store operational data related to financial transactions, payments, and business KPIs
Developing Golang scripts for data transformation and automation
Creating and maintaining dashboards and reports in Google Looker
Helping non-technical teams become self-sufficient in reporting, guiding them to create their own reports
Collaborating with business stakeholders to ensure the MIS database supports key financial, sales and operational insights
Exploring AI opportunities to improve automation and reporting efficiency
Supporting the development team when needed


Who We’re Looking For

Below you'll see our skill wish list. Don't worry if you don't check every box. we value mindset and adaptability over rigid qualifications. As a start-up we are growing and learning ourselves, so let's grow together.


Strong interest in financial services, payments, and cards—understanding the business context behind our data is key
Hands-on experience in data engineering, BI reporting, or MIS development is a pig plus
Experience in financial services is an advantage, but a strong interest and willingness to learn is just as important
Skilled in Golang, Postgres, and Google Looker
Understanding of SQL and relational databases for structured data organization
A problem-solving mindset with the motivation to figure things out and optimize workflows
Passionate about teaching and enabling others
Interest in AI-driven improvements and a willingness to explore new technologies
Ability to work independently, but also collaborate with teams across different functions


Why Join YAPEAL?

At YAPEAL, We’re On a Mission To Transform The Future Of Finance, And We’re Looking For Visionaries Like You To Join Our Journey. Here’s Why YAPEAL Is Maybe Your Place To Be

A Culture of Innovation and Flexibility

Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking team that values creativity, flexibility, and customer success. At YAPEAL, every idea matters, and every voice counts. We give our people all the flexibility they need to thrive and succeed.

Unmatched Growth Opportunities

As an expanding company, your contribution will directly shape our success and market presence. This is your chance to grow with us and make a tangible impact on the future of finance.

If this sounds like the challenge you’ve been waiting for, we’d love to hear from you.

About Us

Based in Zurich, Switzerland, YAPEAL is revolutionizing the financial landscape with our embedded finance solutions. We empower businesses to seamlessly integrate financial services into their products, enhancing customer experiences and unlocking new revenue streams. Combining cutting-edge technology with Swiss reliability, we’re setting a new standard for digital finance. Join us in building a future that’s uniquely dependable, and consistently innovative.
Show more

Title: Database Engineer
Description:
Database Administrator/Developer

Permanent Position

Neuchatel, Switzerland

Up to 95,000 CHF




We’re on the hunt for a dedicated and skilled Database Administrator with a passion for development! If you thrive in a dynamic environment and love ensuring databases run smoothly, efficiently, and securely, this is the perfect role for you.




As a key player in this team, you’ll take ownership of maintaining, optimizing, and enhancing the database infrastructure. You’ll work closely with the lead database developer, driving forward exciting projects that shape the backbone of our cutting-edge products. Your analytical mindset, problem-solving skills, and deep technical expertise will directly contribute to the stability, performance, and success of the platform.




What You’ll Do:

Develop and maintain database structures, procedures, reports, and analytics queries.
Ensure high availability, security, and performance of our databases.
Monitor database usage, response times, and optimize performance.
Design and implement backup, archiving, and storage strategies.
Collaborate with developers and technical teams to drive database improvements.




What We’re Looking For:

3+ years of experience in database administration & development.
Strong expertise in MSSQL
Detail-oriented, independent, and a strong team player.
English & French speaking/writing ability




If you think you would be a great addition to the team, apply now!




5V Video are acting as an Employment Agency for the purposes of this job vacancy. We offer a reward scheme if you can recommend someone for this position, up to €250 for you and an additional €250 to a charity of your choice, 5V Video are recognised talent solutions experts within Video and Broadcast Technology working across Europe, the UK and North America.

Show more
